title: Data Analyst
description: Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?<p><br></p>We now have more data than ever before but providers don't have the infrastructure or expertise to make sense of said data. Here at Tempus, we are building the infrastructure to modernize cancer treatment and derive insights from the mass accumulation of clinical and molecular data. There is an endless stream of questions that we can ask of the data- and we need your help to find the answers!<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with our external data partnership and business development teams to build a full picture of existing and new data attributes</li><li>Profile and analyze data to identify opportunities to both improve and to put to use segments of the Tempus data asset</li><li>Work closely with other Tempus teams in identifying ways to use Tempus data assets to drive patient outcomes and growth opportunities at Tempus</li><li>Team up with other Tempus analysts to quickly respond to query requests from internal and external key stakeholders</li><li>Own quality control of inbound and outbound datasets</li><li>Work with internal teams to identify and resolve risks to data quality and integrity</li><li>Become an expert in our data infrastructure and serve as an internal resource as other teams integrate with new data stores</li><li>Map values from various datasets in an overarching effort to merge disjoint data</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of using SQL to aggregate and extract data across multi-table relational database schemas</li><li>2+ years of technical, data, or analytics experience in tech or big-data industry</li><li>Practical experience translating raw data into practical insights and recommendations</li><li>Prior experience with visualizing data (e.g. Tableau, Plotly, R, Power BI, or other graphical tools/packages)</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Heightened attention to detail</li><li>Experience working with disorganized data</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with clinical and/or genomic data</li><li>Experience working with data in Python (e.g. Pandas, Numpy, etc)</li><li>Experience presenting results of analysis to an audience of various levels of data/technical competency</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Payroll Data Analyst
description: <strong>Organizational Summary:</strong><p><br></p>After School Matters is a Chicago-based nonprofit organization that annually offers after-school and summer programs to nearly 19,000 Chicago high school teens to explore and develop their talents while gaining critical skills that will set them up for success in college and beyond.<p><br></p>Thirty years later, now known as After School Matters, our program has engaged more than 350,000 Chicago teens and is the nation’s largest and most successful provider of after-school and summer programs for high school teens. No other organization offers programs to high school students at the scale and quality that we do.<p><br></p>We offer paid apprenticeships led by professionals in the fields of arts, communications and leadership, sports, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math). Our nationally respected youth development model has been replicated in cities across the country and earned us the City Livability Award from the U.S. Conference of Mayors.<p><br></p>Programs take place at community locations throughout the city, including three ASM buildings: downtown at Gallery 37 Center for the Arts, the Michael and Karyn Lutz Center in Belmont Cragin, and the Pullman community at Gately Park.<p><br></p>Currently, After School Matters' annual operating budget is approximately $35M and employs approximately 500 staff across the organization.<p><br></p>For more information, visit<p><br></p><strong>Summary of Position:</strong><p><br></p>The Payroll Data Analyst role is a unique payroll position, as the primary focus is data manipulation and analysis, using functions in Microsoft Excel (such as VLOOKUP, pivot tables, sorting/filtering) to prepare complex teen participant data for payroll processing. The Payroll Data Analyst is responsible for paying the teen apprentices, interns, and assistants as well as assisting with all functions related to the administration of stipends and wages. Such tasks include building data sets, manipulating data, preparing payroll schedules, coordinating payment logistics, and interacting with various stakeholders.<p><br></p><strong>Major Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Data manipulation and payroll processing:<p><br></p><ul><li>Collect and build data sets from our program database (Cityspan) while thinking strategically about the uses of data as it pertains to payroll</li><li>Analyze data using appropriate qualitative and quantitative techniques to ensure all data are valid, reliable, and accurately portrayed for payroll imports and reporting</li><li>Navigate both Cityspan and the ADP WorkforceNow Payroll platform to prepare, process, and audit payrolls</li><li>Upload direct deposit details and research ACH returns</li><li>Process manual checks, replacement checks, and payroll corrections; investigate and resolve payroll discrepancies</li><li>Identify areas for process improvement using technology and propose alternatives</li></ul><p><br></p>Payroll delivery and customer service:<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage the logistics of check and pay card distribution; work with Programs to ensure delivery details are accurate</li><li>Collaborate with various departments for all aspects of the payroll process, from ensuring that teens are properly enrolled in programs to successfully paying teens; contact program liaisons when teens are missing requirements needed to be eligible for payment</li><li>Maintain and audit the outstanding log, replacement check log, stipend appeal log</li><li>Support in-person payroll events, including Wisely Replacement Event and I-9 Collection</li><li>Support the Teen Stipend Hotline and respond to email inquiries</li></ul><p><br></p>Reporting and recordkeeping:<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage the classifications for program payroll and ensure the data is accurately transferred to the Accounting and Financial Planning &amp; Analysis teams</li><li>Prepare and distribute accurate payroll reports and metrics, including the weekly Dashboard to communicate percentages of teens and programs who were paid and pay reports for distribution to Programs team and Instructors</li><li>Complete quarter-end and year-end processes for each payroll</li><li>Manage the distribution of W-2s and 1099s</li><li>Assist in gathering data requested by external auditors</li><li>Maintain and update standard operating procedure</li></ul><p><br></p>Other duties as assigned<p><br></p><strong>Supervisory Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>None</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Demands:</strong><p><br></p>The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to work on a computer for long periods of time.</li><li>Must be able to sit for long periods of time</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Environment:</strong><p><br></p>The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<p><br></p><ul><li>While performing the duties of this job, the employee is not exposed to weather conditions.</li><li>The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Word and Excel including pivot tables and v-lookups </li><li>Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Ability to compile, enter, audit and verify data</li><li>Highly detailed oriented</li><li>Knowledge of ADP’s WorkforceNow preferred</li><li>Working knowledge of payroll-related requirements and regulations</li><li>Ability to multi-task and adjust to rapidly changing priorities in order to address and resolve the most critical and sensitive issues on a timely basis</li><li>Strong orientation to customer service in a fast-paced, high-energy environment</li><li>Energetic team player who works well in collaborative situations</li><li>Ability to work independently and take ownership of projects</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree required</li><li>Experience using Microsoft Excel (vlookup, pivot tables, sorting/filtering data, etc.) is required</li><li>1-2 years of work experience required; data manipulation and payroll experience preferred</li><li>Cook County residency required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Requirements:</strong><p><br></p>Staff are required to provide proof of COVID-19 Vaccination or have an approved medical or sincerely held religious beliefs exemption prior to starting employment. If a medical or sincerely held religious belief exemption is approved, weekly Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) testing is required part of any reasonable accommodation.<p><br></p><strong>How to Apply:</strong><p><br></p>Submit a cover letter and resume at http://www.afterschoolmatters.org/careers/<p><br></p> <em>EEO:</em> <p><br></p><em>After School Matters is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, military discharge status, age, marital status, parental status, or source of income.</em><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>qIsT9jUpTp

title: Data Engineer
description: Cooler Screens is backed and led by some of the most prominent Chicago &amp; Silicon Valley leaders, advisers, and investors and has developed a digital solution to create and transform a multi-billion dollar industry and positively affect the buying experiences of consumers in the US and beyond. If you’re looking to get on the ground floor of the next digital revolution and Chicago tech success story – this opportunity may be for you.<p><br></p>As the Data Engineer at Cooler Screens, you will design and maintain an enterprise data warehouse platform architecture that structures data for analytical processes to support BI and data integration management, which will be foundational in building out our data processing pipeline. You will be responsible for constructing how we identify, absorb, store, and query data across the Cooler Screens platform that scales to the rising growth of the company.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’re excited to contribute to building a robust scalable and robust data platform and shaping an early stage startup</li><li>You’re passionate about building scalable data processing systems and turning data into insights</li><li>You know how to develop solutions to transform and optimize data and have expertise in solutions to build robust data pipelines and repositories</li><li>You’re comfortable working with a variety of BI tools and helping users to develop solutions to gain key data insights</li><li>You’re a critical thinker and enjoy measuring, analyzing, and solving complex problems</li><li>You’re experienced and comfortable in managing data from a variety of sources and formats and using best practices to ensure consistency and quality</li><li>You thrive working both independently and in a team environment</li></ul><p><br></p>What You Need to Succeed<p><br></p><ul><li>You have 4+ years of data engineering development experience </li><li>You have a deep understanding of the data architecture and relevant technologies</li><li>You have hands-on experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark and Hadoop</li><li>You have an advanced understanding of cloud data warehousing solutions</li><li>You have extensive experience with database modeling and design</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Cooler Screens</u></strong><p><br></p>We are transforming retail cooler surfaces into IoT-enabled screens. Our media platform reimagines the brick-and-mortar shopping experience for consumers in the cooler and freezer aisle while delivering new marketing opportunities and smart merchandising for brands and retailers.<p><br></p>We have an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paid time off, and many other perks. Come join our fast-growing team at our headquarters in the heart of Chicago.<p><br></p>We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, native origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Jr. Clinical Trials Data Specialist
description: *Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote*<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm is looking for a Data Governance Analyst. This analyst will need to have experience in data governance disciplines: metadata management; data quality analysis; data quality remediation; data profiling and data lineage and IBM Information Server Suite 11.x. They also will use SQL and DataStage.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead Data Domain and Data Steward Workgroup meetings</li><li>Work closely with Data Domain Owners and SME's to identify CDE's (Critical Data Elements) and define data elements for the Business Glossary</li><li>Collaborate with Data Domain Owners to identify and define appropriate business rules</li><li>Collaborate with the Metadata specialist to identify data sources</li><li>Collaborate with data modelers to review definitions of business terms vs. technical terms</li><li>Utilize data profiling and data quality tools to expose and determine causes of data quality issues when defining business rules</li><li>Participate in metadata management utilizing IBM Metadata Asset Manager and the IBM Information Governance Catalog to build out the business glossary</li><li>Implement data governance controls, procedures, and standards</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline</li><li>7+ years of experience in data governance disciplines: metadata management; data quality analysis; data quality remediation; data profiling and data lineage</li><li>7+ years of experience with IBM Information Server Suite 11.x</li><li>Proficient with SQL</li><li>Proficient with Microsoft Office desktop tools (Word, Excel, etc.)</li><li>Database experience a plus (ie Oracle, SQL Server, DB2)</li><li>Java</li><li>ETL tools (DataStage etc.)</li><li>[Preferred] DAMA certification preferred</li></ul>

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: <strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years of solid SQL experience. </li><li>Experience with creating SQL tables, stored procedures, queries, SSRS reports and SSIS packages.</li><li>Ability to analyze, troubleshoot and performance tune Microsoft SQL databases and clusters.</li><li>Hands-on experience working with warehouse management systems ( WMS ) or ERPs from implementation to configuration. Manhattan SCALE WMS experience is a strong plus.</li><li>Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.</li><li>Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to communicate effectively with groups of managers, clients, and customers.</li><li>Ability to analyze complex issues related to performance, and efficiency.</li><li>Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.</li><li>Bachelor’s Degree ( B.A. or B.S. ), or equivalent technical certification (i.e. MCSA, etc.) is desirable.</li><li>Flexibility to be on a 24x7 on-call rotation as needed. </li><li>Infrequent travel for conferences, or rare on-site client visits.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Pluses</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Exposure to .NET, Zebra label code, Tableau, data warehousing or other programming.</li><li>Knowledge of database design with concurrency optimization.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: SQL Developer
description: <strong><u>Roles And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solution Design: Collaborate with business stakeholders and technical teams to understand data requirements, define business intelligence objectives, and design Power BI solutions that align with the organization's goals and strategies.</li><li>Data Modeling: Develop data models and data flows to support efficient and accurate data visualization. Design and implement data transformations, aggregations, calculation groups and calculations to create meaningful insights and metrics.</li><li>Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI. Ensure data accuracy and consistency throughout the visualizations and provide insights in a clear and understandable manner.</li><li>Data Integration: Work closely with data engineers and developers to identify and extract data from various sources such as databases, data warehouses, and APIs. Transform and cleanse data as needed for effective analysis and reporting. Implement data security and access controls to ensure data confidentiality.</li><li>Performance Optimization: Optimize Power BI solutions for improved performance and scalability. Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, enhance query performance, and implement caching mechanisms to optimize data retrieval.</li><li>Security and Governance: Implement security measures and data governance policies to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data. Define and enforce data access controls, data classification, and data retention policies in line with organizational standards and compliance requirements.</li><li>Data Refresh and Automation: Schedule and manage data refresh processes to ensure the availability of up-to-date information in Power BI reports and dashboards.</li><li>Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor Power BI solutions for data accuracy, performance issues, and system health. Proactively identify and resolve issues, perform regular maintenance tasks, and apply necessary updates and patches to keep the system up to date.</li><li>Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest Power BI features, best practices, and industry trends. Evaluate and recommend new tools, technologies, and methodologies to enhance the overall data visualization and analytics capabilities.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proven experience as a Power BI Lead or Architect, with expertise in designing and implementing Power BI solutions.</li><li>Experienced in resolving performance issues on large scale BI implementation on big data platforms.</li><li>Experienced in CI/CD and setting up automated testing of Power BI reports</li><li>Experienced in setting up monitoring and alerting for performance and operational issues with Power BI reports and environment.</li><li>Strong knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and business intelligence concepts</li><li>Proficiency in Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, M, and Power BI Service</li><li>Experience with data integration and ETL processes</li><li>Familiarity with SQL and relational databases</li><li>Solid understanding of data visualization principles and best practices.</li><li>Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders.</li><li>Knowledge of cloud platforms GCP and their integration with Power BI is a plus.</li><li>Relevant certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Microsoft Certified: Power BI Certified is preferred.</li></ul>

Design and implement data transformations, aggregations, calculation groups and calculations to create meaningful insights and metrics.</li><li>Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI. Ensure data accuracy and consistency throughout the visualizations and provide insights in a clear and understandable manner.</li><li>Data Integration: Work closely with data engineers and developers to identify and extract data from various sources such as databases, data warehouses, and APIs. title: Power BI lead
description: <em>At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us.</em><p><br></p><em>The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees’ personal and professional lives.</em><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary:</strong><p><br></p>The Data Engineer II manages and develops data processes to cleanse, transform, load, and/or export data to/from the data warehouse, to support commercial teams.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Utilizes the Microsoft SQL Server database software to manage and house data from multiple sources</li><li>Assists in the designing of data structures that can support large amounts of data, are easy to use, and processes efficiently; implements creation of data structures</li><li>Designs, creates, and QCs ETL (Extract Transform Load) processes via SQL Server’s SSIS functionality, Databricks, Azure Data Factory and Python</li><li>Incorporates robust data validation, cleansing, and management methodologies</li><li>Builds processes with a strong focus on automation and repeatable processes</li><li>Documents processes and associated business logic</li><li>Executes simple and complex queries to pull data to support and/or answer adhoc questions</li><li>Works with manager(s) to project plan, establish timelines, and map out associated tasks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong><ul><li>BA/BS required</li><li>5+ years of experience in a similar role</li><li>Experience in the pharmaceutical industry or technology consulting, including experience in Database Architecture and/or Software Development preferred</li><li>Proficient in all components of SQL Server:</li><ul><li>Transact-SQL</li><li>Tables, keys, and indices</li><li>Stored Procedures, Functions, and Views</li></ul><li>Experience with Python</li><li>Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)</li><li>Strong documentation and quality assurance skills</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office.</li><li>Professional, proactive demeanor.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.</em>

title: Data Engineer II, Data Infrastructure
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><strong>As part of our </strong><strong>Enterprise Data Management team</strong><strong>, you’ll:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop data-driven solutions with current and next generation technologies to meet evolving business needs. </li><li>Provide technical design and develop Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) applications that interface with all key Discover applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and troubleshoots data integration solutions with complex data transformations and provides guidance to other team members.</li><li>Influences other team members to achieve commitments per guidance from Chapter Leads and actively contributes to agile ceremonies.</li><li>Demonstrates strong technical aptitude across data engineering practices.</li><li>Utilizing variety of tools to profile, secure the data in transit and at rest; and to enforce data Governance Controls and Alerting</li><li>Designing advanced SQL queries</li><li>Leveraging metadata-driven framework for solutions</li><li>Developing test scripts for unit and integration testing</li><li>Develops test methodologies for specific products.</li><li>Leads code review sessions and other process and operational improvement initiatives.</li><li>Exhibits fluency with use of supplemental tools and technologies involved in data integration (Unix/Linux, TWS/Control-M or alike, BI stack)</li><li>Works on holistic solutions, driving feature and story delivery (Agile)</li><li>Identifies and effectively communicates upstream and downstream impacts for changes in the data pipeline.</li><li>Participates in the on-call rotation for support.</li><li>Demonstrates effective and clear communication in team and cross-functional meetings, and lead tech communities.</li><li>Builds strong collaborative working relationships both within the team and cross-functionally.</li></ul><li></li><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You’ll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics:</strong><strong> </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field  </li><li>3+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering .</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>ETL/ELT Tools (AbInitio, DataStage, Informatica)</li><li>Cloud Tools and Databases (AWS, Snowflake)</li><li>Other programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, etc.)</li><li>Leverage CI/CD framework for data integration, Open Source</li><li>Experience working in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)</li><li>Basic understanding of key infrastructure concepts (data centers as well as cloud hosting platform) to support business data needs</li><li>Experience optimizing SQL both relational and nosql</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Data Engineer (AbInitio/Informatica)
description: <strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We create quality, innovative technology solutions that solve complex, meaningful problems for our clients.<p><br></p>At RedMane our people are our business and we put a great deal of focus not only on hiring the right people, but also on keeping them happy and engaged. We have an open, non-hierarchical culture that is collaborative, inclusive and fun.<p><br></p>RedMane has full-time, Chicago-based opportunity for entry-level software developers as we continue to grow our business. Candidate must be authorized to work in the United States; the Company will not sponsor work visas or other employment authorization.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>As an entry level software developer, you will work in a collaborative environment where you will play a key role in designing, developing, testing, maintaining, and delivering customized mission critical solutions to our clients.<p><br></p><strong>Day to Day Activities include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Maintaining existing applications for current clients</li><li>Constantly improving skills set and sharing new knowledge with others on the team.</li><li>Design, develop, document, test and debug complex and large-scale applications.</li><li>Participate in the full software development life cycle.</li><li>Analyze code to find causes of errors and revise the applications as needed.</li><li>Participate in software design meetings to analyze and determine user needs are met with technical requirements.</li><li>Work collaboratively with development team to design and implement product features to meet delivery dates.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors or master’s degree in computer science or related field</li><li>Must have an interest in and willingness to learn diverse technologies</li><li>Strong understanding of Object Oriented Software Design and Development concepts </li><li>Java programming experience developing web-based applications</li><li>Familiarity with software development lifecycle and design patterns.</li><li>Experience with object-oriented design and related tools (UML, Rational)</li><li>Experience with MS SQL Server, or database design a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>RedMane provides a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge and helping your co-workers succeed is the norm.<p><br></p>We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career, and we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<p><br></p>Competitive compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability, life insurance, etc.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

implements creation of data structures</li><li>Incorporates robust data validation, cleansing, and management methodologies</li><li>Builds processes with a strong focus on automation and repeatable processes leveraging Azure Data Factory</li><li>Documents processes and associated business logic</li><li>Create and execute test plans, use cases and scripts</li><li>Executes simple and complex queries to pull data to support and/or answer adhoc questions</li><li>Works with manager(s) to project plan, establish timelines, and map out associated tasks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong><ul><li>BA/BS required</li><li>5+ years of experience in a similar role</li><li>Experience in the pharmaceutical industry or technology consulting, including experience in Database Architecture and/or Software Development preferred</li><li>Experience with Reltio or Informatica MDM Software preferred</li><li>Proficient in these technical capabilities:</li><ul><li>Python scripting</li><li>SSIS Stored Procedures</li><li>SQL</li><li>Databricks Delta Tables</li><li>Shell Scripting</li></ul><li>Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel</li><li>Strong documentation and quality assurance skills</li><li>Exceptional work ethic</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Professional, proactive demeanor</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.</em>

title: Entry-level Software Developer - Chicago
description: Starting salary of <strong>60</strong><strong><strong>,</strong>000 USD per annum</strong> in a zero-tax environment.<p><br></p>Fast progression for strong performers.<p><br></p><strong>Job location: </strong>Dubai, UAE<p><br></p><strong>About us:</strong><p><br></p>Cobblestone Energy is a proprietary trading firm that specializes in the wholesale electricity market across Europe. Electricity is fundamental to the world's economic activities. We trade enough electricity every day to power a small country, and in doing so, we help to address the mismatch between electricity generation and consumption.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description </strong><p><br></p>At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role. <p><br></p>If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you. <p><br></p><strong>What we offer in this role</strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers. </li><li>A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment. </li><li>An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues. </li><li>Vast growth potential in every aspect. </li><li>15% target bonus with further upside. </li><li>Employee share scheme participation </li><li>International relocation support </li><li>Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes.  </li><li>Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities.  </li><li>Test &amp; debug programs and fix any reported bugs.  </li><li>Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.  </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering.  </li><li>Programming experience of 1 to 2 years in Python language.  </li><li>Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...).  </li><li>Experience of 1 to 2 years in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, ...etc.  </li><li>Knowledge of APIs and webservices.  </li><li>Knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language.  </li><li>Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus.  </li><li>Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus.  </li><li>Ability to work in a team environment.  </li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills.  </li><li>Resilience and a determination to succeed.  </li><li>Independent thinkers with growth mindset.  </li><li>Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly.  </li><li>Strong sense of integrity.   </li><li>Personal values that match our company values. </li></ul>

description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Data Warehouse Developer- Hybrid (2 days in office and prefer only W2)<br><br>6&amp;plus; months contract<br><br>Chicago,IL<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Design, develop, and maintain the data warehouse using Oracle database and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) for ETL.<br><br>Work with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data warehousing solutions.<br><br>Develop ETL jobs using ODI to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.<br><br>Perform performance tuning of the data warehouse, ETL jobs, and SQL queries to ensure optimal performance and scalability.<br><br>Develop and maintain data models using Kimball methodology for data warehousing design.<br><br>Support data operations by monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data issues.<br><br>Collaborate with the development team to integrate data warehouse solutions with other enterprise systems.<br><br>Quals--<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>At least 7 years of experience in data warehousing development, implementation, and support.<br><br>Strong SQL analysis skills and experience in database tuning and optimization.<br><br><strong><u>Experience In Data Modeling Using Kimball Methodology Is Preferred.<br><br></u></strong>At least 3 years of experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c version.<br><br>Excellent team player with strong communication skills.<br><br>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.<br><br>This is a Hybrid role with 2 days in office. <strong>Job #: 23-11203</strong>

title: Data Warehouse Developer #: 23-11203
description: <strong><u>About Our Teams</u></strong><p><br></p>At Tempus, products are owned and developed by small, autonomous teams composed of developers, designers, data scientists, and product managers. You and your team set the goals, build the software, deploy the code, and contribute to a growing software platform that will make a lasting impact in the field of cancer research and treatment.<p><br></p>As a Data Platform Engineer at Tempus, you will architect and implement cloud-native data pipelines and infrastructure to enable analytics and machine learning on Tempus’s rich clinical, molecular, and imaging datasets.<p><br></p><strong><u>Why We’re Looking For You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You know what it takes to build and run resilient data pipelines in production and have experience implementing ETL/ELT to load a multi-terabyte enterprise data warehouse.</li><li>You have implemented analytics applications using multiple database technologies, such as relational, multidimensional (OLAP), key-value, document, or graph.</li><li>You value the importance of defining data contracts, and have experience writing specifications including REST APIs.</li><li>You write code to transform data between data models and formats, preferably in Python or PySpark.</li><li>You've worked in agile environments and are comfortable iterating quickly.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Bonus Points For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience moving trained machine learning models into production data pipelines.</li><li>Healthcare domain knowledge and experience with healthcare transmission formats (e.g. FHIR, HL7, ANSI X12) and data models (e.g OMOP).</li><li>Expert knowledge of relational database modeling concepts, SQL skills, proficiency in query performance tuning, and desire to share knowledge with others.</li><li>Experience building cloud-native applications and supporting technologies / patterns / practices including: AWS, Docker, CI/CD, DevOps, and microservices.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Tempus</u></strong><p><br></p>Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?<p><br></p>We're on a mission to connect an entire ecosystem to redefine how genomic data is used in clinical settings. We're looking for software engineers who are passionate about changing the status quo and bringing cancer care into the 21st century.<p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description: <strong>Data Warehouse Developer- Hybrid (2 days in office and prefer only W2)<br> 6+ months contract<br> Chicago,IL<br></strong> <br> Job Responsibilities :<br> Design, develop, and maintain the data warehouse using Oracle database and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) for ETL.<br> Work with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data warehousing solutions.<br> Develop ETL jobs using ODI to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.<br> Perform performance tuning of the data warehouse, ETL jobs, and SQL queries to ensure optimal performance and scalability.<br> Develop and maintain data models using Kimball methodology for data warehousing design.<br> Support data operations by monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data issues.<br> Collaborate with the development team to integrate data warehouse solutions with other enterprise systems.<br> <br> Quals--<br> Requirements:<br> At least 7 years of experience in data warehousing development, implementation, and support.<br> Strong SQL analysis skills and experience in database tuning and optimization.<br> Experience in data modeling using Kimball methodology is preferred.<br> At least 3 years of experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c version.<br> Excellent team player with strong communication skills.<br> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.<br> <br> This is a Hybrid role with 2 days in office.

title: Data Platform Engineer
description: <strong>SECURITY OPERATIONS, ASSET MANAGEMENT</strong><p><br></p>Northern Trust Asset Management (NTAM) is an over a trillion dollar investment management firm entrusted by investors around the globe to help them navigate changing market environments, so they can confidently realize their long-term objectives.<p><br></p>The security Data function is primarily responsible for overseeing daily global operations of the security master processes and associated activities for NTAM. This role will report into the Lead of Security Ops to develop and execute the strategic roadmap to build a world-class security master organization to respond to NTAM's evolving requirements. It will involve identifying, solutioning, and championing initiatives to build new capabilities such as increased automation, enhanced governance and reporting.<p><br></p><strong>Key Duties And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engage in the day to day responsibilities as it relates to global security master data processes across all NTAM clients, accounts and funds.</li><li>Ensure data completeness and consistency between IBOR &amp; ABOR. Monitor KPIs to measure effectiveness.</li><li>Lead initiatives related to improving data quality in the core NTAM platforms</li><li>Provide project support and planning: develops test plans and user acceptance testing criteria.</li><li>Evaluate and makes recommendations on techniques, practices or technologies that would enhance data related business needs</li><li>Respond to ad-hoc information requests, analyze, gather and research information and develop reports in response to management and/or regulatory requests.</li><li>Assist in the development of data quality management, data acquisition, data and system support.</li><li>Develop service levels with the business, establish a robust governance and control framework to ensure delivery of timely and accurate information, and monitor on-going effectiveness.</li><li>Drive initiatives to strengthen the first line of defense, instilling a culture of continuous improvement and robust policy and procedure documentation to reduce operational risk.<br><br></li></ul> <strong>NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of the investment management business, multiple asset classes, and investment/financial technology systems within an Asset Management setting.</li><li>Demonstrated passion for data, process design and automation.</li><li>Problem solving, analytics, influencing, facilitation and consensus building.</li><li>Dynamic relationship building and partnership skills</li><li>Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Experience in driving digital and automation-driven transformation to drive efficiencies and scalability<br><br></li></ul> <strong>NECESSARY EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor degree; financial management related courses strongly preferred. </li><li>2-4 years of work experience in the investment management industry</li><li>Proficiency with investment as well as reporting and analytic tools and databases. </li><li>Knowledge of applications like Aladdin and Eagle would be a huge plus.<br><br></li></ul> <strong>WORKING MODEL: HYBRID</strong><p><br></p>We have a balanced hybrid working model to ensure you get the flexibility you need, and the successful candidate will spend their time between working in the office and working from home. This role can be based only in our Chicago and Tempe offices.<p><br></p>Additional Information

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description: <br><br>Job Responsibilities :<br> <br> Design, develop, and maintain the data warehouse using Oracle database and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) for ETL.<br> Work with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data warehousing solutions.<br> Develop ETL jobs using ODI to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.<br> Perform performance tuning of the data warehouse, ETL jobs, and SQL queries to ensure optimal performance and scalability.<br> Develop and maintain data models using Kimball methodology for data warehousing design.<br> Support data operations by monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data issues.<br> Collaborate with the development team to integrate data warehouse solutions with other enterprise systems.<br> <br> Quals--<br> Requirements:<br> At least 7 years of experience in data warehousing development, implementation, and support.<br> Strong SQL analysis skills and experience in database tuning and optimization.<br> Experience in data modeling using Kimball methodology is preferred.<br> At least 3 years of experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c version.<br> Excellent team player with strong communication skills.<br> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.<br>

title: Investment Operations Data Analyst
description: Formulates and defines system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding to design, develop, modify, or integrate moderately complex information systems. Devises or modifies application systems and procedures to optimize functional requirements including capacity, operating time, response time, and form of desired results. Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs, subroutines, and scripts. May serve one or more project team roles, such as project lead, business systems analyst, or technical lead, for small to medium efforts. Competent to work on most phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities. Maintains technical skill set for software languages, databases, platforms, operating systems, utilities and networks needed to support work assignments. Assists in preparing and maintaining application design document. Responds to system failures and performance events by taking appropriate measures to reduce system downtime and eliminate recurrence of problems. May conduct presentations to provide end users with knowledge to maximize their use of developed systems. Provides services to multiple concurrent project, project teams or management staff. Provides guidance and suggestions to less-experienced programmers.<p><br></p>Quals--<p><br></p>Must have strong experience ETL Tools, Oracle Data Integrator (1-5 years)<p><br></p>Must have strong experience Oracle SQL, PL/SQL (1-5 years)<p><br></p>Should have strong understanding in BI/data warehouse analysis, design, development &amp; test experience.<p><br></p>Should be able to design, develop and deploy ODI mappings, packages &amp; scenarios.<p><br></p>Experience in writing complex queries, Stored Procedures in Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL<p><br></p>Deep understanding of dimensional data modeling techniques<p><br></p>Experience on working with ODI performance optimization.<p><br></p>Good Team Player<p><br></p>Strong Communication skills

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description: <strong><u>About Our Teams</u></strong><p><br></p>At Tempus, products are owned and developed by small, autonomous teams composed of developers, designers, data scientists, and product managers. You and your team set the goals, build the software, deploy the code, and contribute to a growing software platform that will make a lasting impact in the field of cancer research and treatment.<p><br></p>As a Data Operations Engineer, you’ll be implementing data pipelines to integrate partner data with the world’s largest library of clinical and molecular data.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do At Tempus</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ll analyze, document, and implement data transformation to populate Tempus data models with partner data.</li><li>You’ll implement resilient data pipelines as code to guarantee timely ingestion/egress of partner data.</li><li>You’ll code instrumentation to measure source data quality, and communicate with partners’ technical contacts to resolve live integration issues.</li><li>You’ll identify and socialize improvements to data processing infrastructure and workflows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why We’re Looking For You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You write code to transform data between data models and formats, preferably in Python or PySpark.</li><li>You've worked in agile environments and are comfortable iterating quickly.</li><li>You are comfortable working with high-level direction and querying subject matter experts to extract the information you need to operate in complex domains.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Bonus Points For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with messaging platforms and real-time SOA integration patterns.</li><li>Experience working with RESTful endpoints in ETL processes.Healthcare domain knowledge and experience implementing integrations with healthcare transaction protocols (FHIR, HL7, ANSI X12).</li><li>Experience building cloud-native applications and supporting technologies / patterns / practices including: AWS, Docker, CI/CD, DevOps, and microservices.</li><li>You have knowledge of relational database physical modeling concepts and writing advanced SQL queries.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: ETL Developer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Solving IT International Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>One of the largest health insurers in the nation is focused on continuously building an industry-defining, world-class IT capability. Healthcare is forever evolving, especially due to emerging technologies, making this a great experience to add to your resume. Come join their winning team!<p><br></p>This <strong>Contract-to-Hire </strong> role as a <strong>Database Analyst</strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> will be responsible for designing and developing applications, databases and reports based on long-term business strategy including major enhancements to existing functionality and user tools. This is a <strong>Hybrid</strong> role, 3 day onsite, 2 days remote.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop, maintain, and enhance complex databases used for a variety of areas and functions using SQL, VB, VBA, Access, Excel and other software as applicable. </li><li> Work with users to capture and analyze business and data requirements necessary to meet business needs and corporate strategies/goals. </li><li> Write programs, develop and maintain distributed architecture databases for major corporate functions and develop required reporting. </li><li> Evaluate and recommend to management appropriate hardware/software platform upgrades. </li><li> Maintain documentation of all requests, data parameters and reports in an accurate and accessible manner. </li><li> Streamline reporting as much as possible by automating queries, etc. and/or placing reports in production to minimize manual efforts. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree and 5 years experience in areas of information technology and 2 years of relevant database and application development experience. Requires advanced to expert level knowledge and understanding of database and application systems design and interfaces. </li><li> 3 years experience in SQL programming. </li><li> Thorough knowledge of PC windows-based applications, including Excel, Access, and VBA. </li><li> Skills to anticipate additional reporting parameters and confirm requirements as needed. </li><li> Interprets business issues and recommends business solutions. </li><li> Takes initiative to solves complex problems that have a far-reaching impact on the business. </li><li> Works independently with minimal guidance. </li><li> Verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills necessary to work in team environment. </li><li> Organizational skills and experience managing completion of multiple projects. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree with concentration in Business, Math or Computer Science. </li><li> Experience with Tableau and SharePoint. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits: </strong><p><br></p>Solving IT is pleased to offer a rich benefit plan to our W2 employees. We offer five health plan options and a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&amp;D Insurance, and 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT subsidizes the health and dental premium for the employee.<p><br></p>As you continue to develop your skills and experience, Solving IT will work with your changing preferences to match you with rewarding projects. Our unrivaled reputation for quality is demonstrated through our Inavero Best of Staffing award that was won due to the feedback from our own clients and candidates. We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Database Analyst 29353

title: ETL Developer
description: <strong><u>Job Description Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>We are looking for hands-on individual with strong Linux, networking, and development/scripting experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills And Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years Linux systems engineering experience</li><li>Extensive experience with physical and virtual Linux (RHEL/CentOS) systems.</li><li>Strong grasp of configuration management systems such as Ansible or SaltStack.</li><li>Experience automating monitoring systems like Nagios, Icinga2 or Sensu</li><li>Automation/scripting with bash, Python, Perl or similar</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with low latency, high performance trading systems</li><li>Experience with Cisco, Arista, Palo Alto network hardware including VLANs, VRF, routing protocols, VPNs, ACLs, multicast and NAT.</li><li>Experience with InfluxDB and Grafana</li><li>Familiarity with HPC/grid computing systems like Hadoop, Mesos or Slurm.</li><li>Familiarity with AI acceleration technologies such as CUDA, GPUs, FPGAs, TensorFlow, InfiniBand, NVMe</li><li>Experience with VMware and KVM based virtualization</li><li>Experience with cloud computing systems (AWS, GCP)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Notes</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ideally, they want someone in Chicago but will also consider Austin candidates and they will stay in Austin</li><li>This position is open due to the current employee leaving</li><li>This is really an admin role even though they call it an engineer</li><li>This role is for normal business hours but the individual must be available 24/7 as needed</li><li>The need for scripting languages is just a general requirement but is not a day to day task</li><li>This is really a true Admin role and they are in a maintenance phase right now and not in a big server expansion mode.</li><li>They anticipate a 2-4 week ramp time to get familiar with their systems</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Data Operations Engineer
description: As a UNIX/Linux systems engineer supporting our internal development and testing systems, you will flex your creativity and technical prowess to support the 9,000+ datacenter-housed systems that help Epic improve healthcare delivery for over 72% of patients in the United States, and around the world.<p><br></p>While working on our small, collaborative team of experienced engineers, you'll use analytical and problem-solving skills to take ownership of automation, complex systems architecture projects, and more. Using your creativity and the shared experience of others, you will continuously improve our internal operations and your own depth of technical knowledge.<p><br></p>You'll evaluate, develop, and deploy non-traditional solutions, create utility and automation scripts, create/maintain/support Epic's internal and internet-facing systems, and improve monitoring of Epic's internal server environments.<p><br></p>Enjoy the perks of being an Epic employee in Madison (check out life at Epic and our culinary team), while working with a broad range of technologies in your day-to-day.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. You'll earn competitive wages and receive benefits befitting a leading software company (401k match, great health insurance, life insurance, performance bonuses and stock grants). Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years' experience administering systems in an enterprise setting supporting production databases or applications.</li><li>Experience in deployment, monitoring, performance tuning, and troubleshooting in Linux.</li><li>Experience building tools or automation in languages such as Python or Perl and shell scripting (bash/ksh).</li><li>Comfort administering virtualized environments with VMware vSphere VMs, AIX LPARs, containers, or similar.</li><li>Experience with the following is a plus Backup/Restore, Disaster Recovery, DevOps, systems automation.</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed).</li><li>Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship.</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul>

Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years' experience administering systems in an enterprise setting supporting production databases or applications.</li><li>Experience in deployment, monitoring, performance tuning, and troubleshooting in Linux.</li><li>Experience building tools or automation in languages such as Python or Perl and shell scripting (bash/ksh).</li><li>Comfort administering virtualized environments with VMware vSphere VMs, AIX LPARs, containers, or similar.</li><li>Experience with the following is a plus Backup/Restore, Disaster Recovery, DevOps, systems automation.</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed).</li><li>Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship.</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul>

title: Hybrid Database Analyst 29353
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Software Support Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Solving IT International Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>One of the largest health insurers in the nation is focused on continuously building an industry-defining, world-class IT capability. Healthcare is forever evolving, especially due to emerging technologies, making this a great experience to add to your resume. Come join their winning team!<p><br></p>This <strong>Contract-to-Hire </strong> role as a <strong>Database Analyst</strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> will be responsible for designing and developing applications, databases and reports based on long-term business strategy including major enhancements to existing functionality and user tools. This is a <strong>Hybrid</strong> role, 3 day onsite, 2 days remote.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop, maintain, and enhance complex databases used for a variety of areas and functions using SQL, VB, VBA, Access, Excel and other software as applicable. </li><li> Work with users to capture and analyze business and data requirements necessary to meet business needs and corporate strategies/goals. </li><li> Write programs, develop and maintain distributed architecture databases for major corporate functions and develop required reporting. </li><li> Evaluate and recommend to management appropriate hardware/software platform upgrades. </li><li> Maintain documentation of all requests, data parameters and reports in an accurate and accessible manner. </li><li> Streamline reporting as much as possible by automating queries, etc. and/or placing reports in production to minimize manual efforts. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree and 5 years experience in areas of information technology and 2 years of relevant database and application development experience. Requires advanced to expert level knowledge and understanding of database and application systems design and interfaces. </li><li> 3 years experience in SQL programming. </li><li> Thorough knowledge of PC windows-based applications, including Excel, Access, and VBA. </li><li> Skills to anticipate additional reporting parameters and confirm requirements as needed. </li><li> Interprets business issues and recommends business solutions. </li><li> Takes initiative to solves complex problems that have a far-reaching impact on the business. </li><li> Works independently with minimal guidance. </li><li> Verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills necessary to work in team environment. </li><li> Organizational skills and experience managing completion of multiple projects. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree with concentration in Business, Math or Computer Science. </li><li> Experience with Tableau and SharePoint. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits: </strong><p><br></p>Solving IT is pleased to offer a rich benefit plan to our W2 employees. We offer five health plan options and a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&amp;D Insurance, and 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT subsidizes the health and dental premium for the employee.<p><br></p>As you continue to develop your skills and experience, Solving IT will work with your changing preferences to match you with rewarding projects. Our unrivaled reputation for quality is demonstrated through our Inavero Best of Staffing award that was won due to the feedback from our own clients and candidates. We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Database Analyst 29353
