We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Database Analyst 29353

title: Linux Admin/Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description: </strong><p><br></p><strong> Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> At least 7 years of experience in data warehousing development, implementation, and support. </li><li> Strong SQL analysis skills and experience in database tuning and optimization. </li><li> Experience in data modeling using Kimball methodology is preferred. </li><li> At least 3 years of experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c version. </li><li> Excellent team player with strong communication skills. </li><li> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, and maintain the data warehouse using Oracle database and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) for ETL. </li><li> Work with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data warehousing solutions. </li><li> Develop ETL jobs using ODI to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse. </li><li> Perform performance tuning of the data warehouse, ETL jobs, and SQL queries to ensure optimal performance and scalability. </li><li> Develop and maintain data models using Kimball methodology for data warehousing design. </li><li> Support data operations by monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data issues. </li><li> Collaborate with the development team to integrate data warehouse solutions with other enterprise systems. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> About ASK: </strong><strong> ASK Consulting is an award-winning technology and professional services recruiting firm servicing Fortune 500 organizations nationally. With 5 nationwide offices, two global delivery centers, and employees in 42 states-ASK Consulting connects people with amazing opportunities </strong><p><br></p><strong> ASK Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all associates. </strong><p><br></p>Apply Now

title: UNIX/Linux Systems Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Adaptive Developer<p><br></p><strong>Department:</strong> Finance<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Remote/Hybrid<p><br></p>Acrisure is a fast-growing fintech leader that operates a global insurance broker. The Company has grown from $38 million to $4.0 billion in revenue since 2013 and deploys the best of Human and Artificial Intelligence (AI) at scale to reimagine financial service product distribution. Acrisure employs over 14,000 employees across thirteen countries. <p><br></p>Led by co-founder, Chairman and CEO Greg Williams, Acrisure provides a broad array of insurance and financial related solutions, including commercial property and casualty, personal lines and employee benefits insurance, real estate services, cyber services and asset and wealth management. Acrisure’s massively valuable, high margin distribution network combines the strength of trusted advisors with growth and efficiency enabled by AI.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Primarily responsible for providing consultation and implementation of Workday Adaptive Planning to our various business units. Be a subject matter expert in FP&amp;A practice and the use of planning modules to support organization planning calculation and modeling. The role identifies and implements long-range goals to increase accuracy, gain workload capacity, and create insight while becoming a more technology-enabled company.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyzing financial models and reports (spreadsheet/non-spreadsheet-based models) and translating those models into Adaptive Planning</li><li>Provide technical guidance (design, model, configuration, troubleshooting, etc.) for the Adaptive suite of products.</li><li>Manage data integrations into Adaptive from other source systems to include troubleshooting intermittent data and or break/fix issues</li><li>Work closely with the Director of Finance and team to ensure not only timely and accurate financial reporting, but also provide technical guidance to users to ensure optimization of the system</li><li>Serve as the primary point of contact for Adaptive who will create and revise configurations and customizations to meet evolving business and operational needs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with stakeholders to understand their business and take a consultative approach to designing planning models in Adaptive Planning</li><li>Configure and demonstrate planning prototypes</li><li>Actively participate in update training and internal opportunities to share one’s skills and learnings with others within the organization</li><li>Maintain cutting-edge knowledge of product functionality with each new Workday release</li><li>Demonstrate strong client and stakeholder management to achieve project objectives</li><li>Support innovation through the creation of new industry-leading methods and approach</li><li>Educate team members of diverse technical backgrounds Acrisure Adaptive Planning models &amp; reporting</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing budgets, forecasts, and reports within Adaptive Planning for Finance</li><li>Analyzing financial models and reports (spreadsheet/non-spreadsheet-based models) and translating those models into Adaptive Planning</li><li>Provide technical guidance (design, model, configuration, troubleshooting, etc.) for the Adaptive suite of products</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication, responsiveness, and active listening skills. Successfully translates technical terminology to language that is easily understood and applicable to business priorities. </li><li>Ability to speak to both the financial and technical aspects of EPM</li><li>Experience managing technical upgrades and ETL/data movement is a plus</li><li>Ability to effectively define key objectives, set clear goals, consistently measure and monitor progress &amp; performance, and produce successful results. </li><li>Providing business analysis and requirements gathering.</li><li>Demonstrating project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while being detail-oriented</li><li>Having exposure to business process mapping and/or re-engineering is preferred.</li><li>Thrive in a diverse, fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to use data to identify insights that drive action. </li><li>Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Adaptable. </li><li>Ability to identify business needs, take the initiative to ask questions, and manage expectations unbiasedly. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2 years+ of experience working with Adaptive Planning</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Computer Science, experience in FP&amp;A role a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of Insurance brokerage operations.</li><li>3 years + experience implementing FP&amp;A planning or reporting modules</li><li>Project management certifications and/or focus on Agile concepts. </li><li>Strong Data Management skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. <strong>California</strong> residents can learn more about our privacy practices for applicants by visiting the Acrisure California Applicant Privacy Policy available at www.Acrisure.com/privacy/caapplicant.<p><br></p>Acrisure is equally committed to supporting social issues. In 2021, the Company co-founded Evolution Advisors, a joint venture focused on providing greater access and more effectively distributing insurance products and financial services to minority-owned enterprises. In its home of Grand Rapids, Acrisure provided $15 million to create the Acrisure Center for Innovation in Children’s Health at Helen DeVos Children’s Hospital.<p><br></p>To Executive Search Firms &amp; Staffing Agencies: Acrisure does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies that have not signed a mutual service agreement. All unsolicited resumes will be considered Acrisure’s property, and Acrisure will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting Acrisure’s Human Resources Talent Department.<p><br></p>

Acrisure’s massively valuable, high margin distribution network combines the strength of trusted advisors with growth and efficiency enabled by AI.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Primarily responsible for providing consultation and implementation of Workday Adaptive Planning to our various business units. Be a subject matter expert in FP&amp;A practice and the use of planning modules to support organization planning calculation and modeling. The role identifies and implements long-range goals to increase accuracy, gain workload capacity, and create insight while becoming a more technology-enabled company.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyzing financial models and reports (spreadsheet/non-spreadsheet-based models) and translating those models into Adaptive Planning</li><li>Provide technical guidance (design, model, configuration, troubleshooting, etc.) for the Adaptive suite of products.</li><li>Manage data integrations into Adaptive from other source systems to include troubleshooting intermittent data and or break/fix issues</li><li>Work closely with the Director of Finance and team to ensure not only timely and accurate financial reporting, but also provide technical guidance to users to ensure optimization of the system</li><li>Serve as the primary point of contact for Adaptive who will create and revise configurations and customizations to meet evolving business and operational needs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with stakeholders to understand their business and take a consultative approach to designing planning models in Adaptive Planning</li><li>Configure and demonstrate planning prototypes</li><li>Actively participate in update training and internal opportunities to share one’s skills and learnings with others within the organization</li><li>Maintain cutting-edge knowledge of product functionality with each new Workday release</li><li>Demonstrate strong client and stakeholder management to achieve project objectives</li><li>Support innovation through the creation of new industry-leading methods and approach</li><li>Educate team members of diverse technical backgrounds Acrisure Adaptive Planning models &amp; reporting</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing budgets, forecasts, and reports within Adaptive Planning for Finance</li><li>Analyzing financial models and reports (spreadsheet/non-spreadsheet-based models) and translating those models into Adaptive Planning</li><li>Provide technical guidance (design, model, configuration, troubleshooting, etc.) for the Adaptive suite of products</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication, responsiveness, and active listening skills. Successfully translates technical terminology to language that is easily understood and applicable to business priorities. </li><li>Ability to speak to both the financial and technical aspects of EPM</li><li>Experience managing technical upgrades and ETL/data movement is a plus</li><li>Ability to effectively define key objectives, set clear goals, consistently measure and monitor progress &amp; performance, and produce successful results. </li><li>Providing business analysis and requirements gathering.</li><li>Demonstrating project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while being detail-oriented</li><li>Having exposure to business process mapping and/or re-engineering is preferred.</li><li>Thrive in a diverse, fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to use data to identify insights that drive action. </li><li>Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Adaptable. </li><li>Ability to identify business needs, take the initiative to ask questions, and manage expectations unbiasedly. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2 years+ of experience working with Adaptive Planning</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Computer Science, experience in FP&amp;A role a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of Insurance brokerage operations.</li><li>3 years + experience implementing FP&amp;A planning or reporting modules</li><li>Project management certifications and/or focus on Agile concepts. </li><li>Strong Data Management skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. <strong>California</strong> residents can learn more about our privacy practices for applicants by visiting the Acrisure California Applicant Privacy Policy available at www.Acrisure.com/privacy/caapplicant.<p><br></p>Acrisure is equally committed to supporting social issues. In 2021, the Company co-founded Evolution Advisors, a joint venture focused on providing greater access and more effectively distributing insurance products and financial services to minority-owned enterprises. In its home of Grand Rapids, Acrisure provided $15 million to create the Acrisure Center for Innovation in Children’s Health at Helen DeVos Children’s Hospital.<p><br></p>To Executive Search Firms &amp; Staffing Agencies: Acrisure does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies that have not signed a mutual service agreement. All unsolicited resumes will be considered Acrisure’s property, and Acrisure will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting Acrisure’s Human Resources Talent Department.<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Our client, an established, growing food safety technology company is looking for an Applications Engineer to join their team in the North Side of Chicago, IL as a full-time employee. This is truly a great opportunity to be part of a start-up brand within an existing company. The Applications Engineer will be primarily responsible for all product development engineering and technical support of the detection units in operation at customer sites. The system is comprised of an Analytical Instrument, a User Interface on an iPad and a Consumable Diagnostic Test Kit. The Applications Engineer is responsible for management of product improvements and updates based on customer feedback including Hardware, Software, and Consumable engineering changes. Our client offers the opportunity to be part of an organization with deep history, and instrumental in supporting the company's continued growth.<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. in Electrical Engineering ( EE ), Mechanical Engineering ( ME ), Manufacturing Engineer ( ME ) or other related technical fields. MBA is a strong plus.</li><li>5+ years’ experience in Food Testing, Pathogen Testing, Chemical Testing, Life Sciences, Instrumentation, Semiconductor, Scientific, or similar equipment.</li><li>Demonstrated success leading a complex product development program from the early stages to market introduction.</li><li>Hands-on Applications Engineering experience in at least three of the following areas: motion control, temperature control, automation, lasers, spectroscopic detectors, or electronics.</li><li>Software management experience or cross-functional experience guiding development of instrument control and applications software.</li><li>Expert user of Microsoft Project.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication, coordination, organization and team building skills.</li><li>Ability to work individually or in a group setting, and under pressure with time constraints.</li><li>Ability to successfully present technical information.</li><li>Nationwide travel up to around 20% of the time.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Datawarehouse Developer
description: <strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>The Employee Productivity Tools team is seeking an ambitious self-starter for a position with the possibility of working virtually. The team member will be responsible for Atlassian Jira and Confluence administration. Experience in the ServiceNow space is also a plus. In this position this team member will be involved in development and configuration activities in the ITSM, HRSD, and ITOM workflows. The highly visible team member will work closely with all groups throughout the organization and must think “outside the box”. We practice Agile methodologies and move quickly to adapt.<br><br><strong>Job responsibilities: <br></strong><ul><li>Work with key stakeholders to enable and improve custom workflows, fields, screens, dashboards, and reports.</li><li>Support JIRA administration, including design, creation and management of custom workflows, custom fields, dashboards, addons, reports and integration with other development tools.</li><li>Work closely with the IT and internal Atlassian teams on projects such as major upgrades, data migrations, automations, plugin selection, and integration with other systems.</li><li>Ability to write advanced JQL (Jira Query Language) to create filters and boards for individuals and teams.</li><li>Maintaining customizations across versions and instances of JIRA.</li><li>Work with our development team to extend JIRA integration with other tools.</li><li>Perform regular sessions with internal teams to understand where JIRA processes can be improved and/or streamlined.</li><li>Write clear documentation materials for training purposes.</li><li>Creating and implementing complex pages</li><li>Creating and implementing custom widgets</li><li>Implementing designer-provided user interfaces</li><li>Matching the UI from designs on various pages of a portal</li><li>Resolving UI performance bottlenecks</li><li>Resolving complex widget defects</li><li>Writing ATF tests</li><li>Analyzing usage statistics</li><li>Ensuring custom widgets and pages are ready for upgrade<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent.</li><li>Three to five years of experience managing Atlassian JIRA and Confluence as an administrator is required.</li><li>Experience configuring projects, configuring complex JQL, condition-based workflows, and updating fields based on conditions.</li><li>Experience developing and maintaining Post Functions and ScriptRunner automation.</li><li>Experience in performing Atlassian installations, migrations, and plugin installation.</li><li>Experience developing application/scripts in Groovy.</li><li>Exceptional customer service, organization, interpersonal, time-management and written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>High degree of self-motivation.</li><li>The ability to adapt quickly to new tasks.</li><li>The ability to learn custom applications, support, and troubleshoot.</li><li>3+ years experience developing on the ServiceNow platform</li><li>2+ years experience developing custom service portals</li><li>Experience with integrations, platform configuration, design, and deployment</li><li>Experience with custom application development including Custom Service Portal widget creation</li><li>2+ years of scripting/coding Experience (e.g., JavaScript, AngularJS, HTML, Bootstrap, SQL)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice to have: <br></strong><ul><li>ServiceNow Certifications a plus (bonus for ServiceNow Portal Fundamentals, ServiceNow Portal Advanced)</li><li>Web development experience a plus</li><li>Knowledge of AWS services and Atlassian data center versions of Confluence and Jira are nice to have.<br><br></li></ul>001_MstarInc Morningstar Inc. Legal Entity<br><br>Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

title: Adaptive Developer
description: Help global companies embrace the latest private cloud infrastructure, Linux and cloud native operations, and open source applications. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Linux Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes and a wide range of associated technology.<p><br></p>This role has very diverse responsibilities. The team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.<p><br></p>The people who love this role are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training.<p><br></p>What you'll do:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications</li><li>Design and deploy clouds and applications for external customers</li><li>Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, Ceph, Hadoop and Spark either On-Premises or in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)</li><li>Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values</li><li>Work from the comfort of your home</li><li>Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events</li></ul><p><br></p>Who you are:<p><br></p><ul><li>You have experience in AI/ML and MLOps</li><li>You have practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking</li><li>You have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts &amp; technologies, such as Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc. </li><li>You have an intermediate level of Python programming skills</li><li>You are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people</li><li>You have a demonstrated drive for continual learning</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills (English, Spanish/French a bonus)</li><li>You have great organisational skills and follow-up reliably on commitments</li><li>University degree in Computer Science or related software engineering expertise</li></ul><p><br></p>What you'll learn<p><br></p><ul><li>Linux Ubuntu and networking knowledge</li><li>Kubernetes and OpenStack infrastructure</li><li>Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Platforms</li><li>Wide range of open source applications and skills</li><li>Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses </li><li>Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer:<p><br></p><ul><li>Learning and development tuition reimbursement</li><li>18 weeks parental leave (USA) </li><li>Diversity Resource Groups</li><li>Work from home</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<p><br></p><em>Canonical is a remote-first workplace and will hire candidates in their current living location. For applicants applying from the United States, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job opening.</em><p><br></p><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background leads to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.</em><p><br></p>#stack<p><br></p>

title: Applications Engineer
description: <strong>Network Operations Engineer</strong><p><br></p>12+ months contract<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Will provide operational support, design, engineering, and planning for complex global data network and communications projects. TCP/IP and related protocol connectivity will be essential.</li><li> Manage the interoperability between Cisco and Juniper Layer 3 Platforms, utilizing alarm and ticket systems, customized scripts, customer notifications, and escalations to business partners.</li><li> Deploy new routers, switches, and trunk capacity, and perform necessary configurations.</li><li> Provide real-time, in-depth analysis and troubleshooting for incidents related to CISCO, Juniper, and associated Operations Support Systems and Data Communications Network Technology platforms.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Must Have The Following Skills And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong engineering background; Project-based work experience in a team environment</li><li> Cisco CCNA certification</li><li> Experience in configuring new builds on IOS, IOS-XR, and Arista EOS platforms</li><li> Knowledge of cloud computing and whitebox solutions</li><li> Proficiency in Ethernet/L2 and L3 troubleshooting</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-Have Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience</li><li> Call center experience (at least 3 years of experience)</li><li> CCNP certification</li></ul> Metasys Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Java Engineer (W2)
description: Precise Solutions is an Illinois BEP/FBE (female owned business enterprise) certified consulting company founded in 2000. Our mission is to provide companies with specialized resources that can drive their system portfolio projects using program management processes, change management and blended learning solutions. Please visit our website at www.precise-solutions.com<p><br></p><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following</u></strong><p><br></p>At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries primarily located in the Northern Chicago Suburbs. We are much more than a consulting firm. Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and pension.<p><br></p>Developer- Oracle, PL/SQL, ETL, Informatica<p><br></p>Rate: $40-$45 including benefits<p><br></p><strong><u>Must Have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Informatica Development experience with tool and process </li><li>PL/SQL expereince </li><li>SDLC </li><li>Oracle/SQL Server </li><li>Datawarehouse </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have Expereince</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Qlik integration </li><li>MKS</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>The Successful Candidate Must Possess The Following Competencies</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must have a minimum of 5-7 years of experience working in an IT organization (with 4-5 years working with Informatica development and 2 years of design experience). </li><li>Must be able to quickly understand the business objective of a system and able to come up to speed on the function and capability of the system necessary to provide system support for the business client.</li><li>Must understand SLC concepts and have experience in working with SLC deliverables </li><li>Must have strong programming skill &amp; experience in Informatica. title: Employee Technology Systems Engineer
description: <strong>Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work on bleeding edge Kubernetes deployments and solutions.</li><li>Opportunity to work on telco scale problems.</li><li>Distributed and cloud-native product architecture.</li><li>Freedom to innovate and explore efficient solutions.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrate eagerness to learn and master Kubernetes and Cloud-native deployment and infrastructure.</li><li>Innovate continuously and help the product continue to lead in the telco automation and orchestration space.</li><li>Design and develop high-quality software.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Hands-on development, and design of critical modules for the Telco Cloud Automation Product.</li><li>Work closely with architects, different teams, and QEE to develop innovative and efficient infrastructure automation solutions</li><li>Work across multiple VMware product teams and develop inclusive solutions.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work as an individual contributor and work in a small team of 4-5 engineers.</li><li>You will work under a tech lead or an architect and work on a module.</li><li>Customer-focused and detail-oriented team culture.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Where is this role located?</strong><p><br></p>Flexible/Remote: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from a local VMware office and/or remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager.<p><br></p><strong>What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?</strong><p><br></p>You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types</li><li>Generous Time Off Programs</li><li>40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community</li><li>Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities</li><li>Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)</li><li>Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes</li></ul><p><br></p>For US based candidates, the annual pay range (OTE for commissioned roles; Salary for other roles) for this position is: $84,000 - $190,000. The actual offer will be based on the role, location, and individual candidate experience. Bonus, commission, and/or equity may be eligible for this position. VMware offers comprehensive benefits including, but not limited to: medical, dental, and vision plans, company paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation time. Additional benefits for this position can be found at https://benefits.vmware.com/. Your talent advisor can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.<p><br></p>This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry.<p><br></p><strong>Category : </strong>Engineering and Technology<p><br></p><strong>Subcategory: </strong>Software Engineering<p><br></p><strong>Experience: </strong>Manager and Professional<p><br></p><strong>Full Time/ Part Time: </strong>Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Posted Date:</strong> 2023-06-22<p><br></p>VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.<p><br></p>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

title: Cloud Field Engineer - Americas (Remote) - Entry Level
description: <strong>Job - ETL Developer<br></strong> <strong> Location – Chicago, IL<br></strong> <strong> Duration – 6+ Months<br></strong>  <br> <strong> Only W2 Acceptable<br></strong> <br> <strong> Job Description</strong><ul> <li> Formulates and defines system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding to design, develop, modify, or integrate moderately complex information systems.</li> <li> Devises or modifies application systems and procedures to optimize functional requirements including capacity, operating time, response time, and form of desired results.</li> <li> Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs, subroutines, and scripts.</li> <li> May serve one or more project team roles, such as project lead, business systems analyst, or technical lead, for small to medium efforts.</li> <li> Competent to work on most phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities.</li> <li> Maintains technical skill set for software languages, databases, platforms, operating systems, utilities and networks needed to support work assignments.</li> <li> Assists in preparing and maintaining application design document.</li> <li> Responds to system failures and performance events by taking appropriate measures to reduce system downtime and eliminate recurrence of problems.</li> <li> May conduct presentations to provide end users with knowledge to maximize their use of developed systems. Provides services to multiple concurrent projects, project teams or management staff.</li> </ul> <ul> <li> Provides guidance and suggestions to less-experienced programmers.<br> <br> <strong> Quals--<br></strong>  </li> <li> Must have strong experience ETL Tools, Oracle Data Integrator (1-5 years)</li> <li> Must have strong experience Oracle SQL, PL/SQL (1-5 years)</li> <li> Should have strong understanding in BI/data warehouse analysis, design, development &amp; test experience.</li> <li> Should be able to design, develop and deploy ODI mappings, packages &amp; scenarios.</li> <li> Experience in writing complex queries, Stored Procedures in Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL</li> <li> Deep understanding of dimensional data modeling techniques</li> <li> Experience on working with ODI performance optimization.</li> <li> Good Team Player</li> <li> Strong Communication skills</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer - Opportunity for Working Remotely
description: If you enjoy <strong>bold</strong> choices, “<em>unicorn</em>” creations and going off the grid to dominate an industry, let’s chat.<p><br></p>We’re looking for a Solutions Engineer who loves evangelizing technical concepts, solving problems, and wants to play a major role in increasing the adoption of best practices at our customers. We are here to make life easier for our customers and to leave them with the “wow” feeling of having solved integration, data management and analytics issues with ease, style and class.<p><br></p>The role is both highly technical and customer facing. As a Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for helping our customers adopt the Ship.Cars platform by applying our best practices, tools and industry knowledge, from machine data ingest to building out use cases (alerts, dashboards, etc.). You will enable customers to leverage our platform to troubleshoot and monitor their applications and infrastructure. This role also interfaces with various teams within Ship.Cars such as Product Management, Engineering, Sales, Sales Engineering and Support.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have in-depth knowledge of the software development lifecycle, operations &amp; infrastructure and/or cyber security areas as well as experience interfacing with highly technical customers in a pre- or post-sales capacity. Additionally, general knowledge of the current IT landscape, cloud computing and modern tools and methodologies is required.<p><br></p><strong><u>You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform client needs evaluation by working with Sales in Pre-Sales solution capacity.</li><li>Design and provide quote utilizing Ship.Cars product and offerings</li><li>Collect required information to develop work scope around solutions to attain customer requirements along with data expertise as required.</li><li>Interact with prospective and existing clients to collect information and provide proposed solutions.</li><li>Support potential opportunities closure.</li><li>Involve actively in training programs as well as pass certification exams.</li><li>Head responsibility for technical validity along with integration and interoperability of solution.</li><li>Coordinate issues resolution activities with varied organizations.</li><li>Review problem logs and identify recurring problems.</li><li>Record projects status along with open issues every week.</li><li>Ensure to follow up on problems and process independently related to solutions engineering.</li><li>Assist team to design, plan and implement secure network solution.</li><li>Participate in seminars, trade shows and oversee internal demonstration facilities etc.</li><li>Develop and present customer presentations at every enterprise customer’s organization level.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>You’ll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Five or more years hands-on experience in a customer facing software implementation role</li><li>Knowledge of operating systems, databases and modern and traditional application stacks</li><li>Experience with public cloud services such as AWS</li><li>Ability to write complex regular expressions</li><li>Experience writing scripts in languages such as Python, Ruby or Perl</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to present to large groups in a training setting</li><li>The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth and rapidly changing environment</li><li>NO RECRUITERS PLEASE***********</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Local candidates only</strong><p><br></p><strong>Remote applicants will not be considered</strong><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Python Trading Engineer
description: Cooler Screens is backed and led by some of the most prominent Chicago &amp; Silicon Valley leaders, advisers, and investors and has developed a digital solution to transform a multi-billion dollar industry and positively affect the buying experiences of consumers in the US and beyond. If you’re looking to get on the ground floor of the next digital revolution and Chicago tech success story – this opportunity may be for you.<p><br></p>As a Front End Developer with Cooler Screens, you will use your experience to help us reimagine the digital in-store shopper experience. You will be working hands-on with our technical and design teams creating our in-store IoT solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are passionate about development and eager to expand your knowledge within a fast-paced start-up environment.</li><li>You are an innovator who thrives on tough technical challenges and finds ways to apply technology to solve business problems.</li><li>You’ll work directly with proven leaders as an integral part of the development and growth of our company. Our digital- and design-led culture allows you to think creatively, challenge the status quo, and use your abilities to change the face of retail forever. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience in a full-time development role</li><li>Proven experience with front-end technologies such as JavaScript and React</li><li>B.S. preferred, in Computer Science or related discipline</li><li>Azure platform experience preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Cooler Screens</u></strong><p><br></p>We are transforming retail cooler surfaces into IoT-enabled screens. Our media platform reimagines the brick-and-mortar shopping experience for consumers in the cooler and freezer aisle while delivering new marketing opportunities and smart merchandising for brands and retailers.<p><br></p>We have an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paid time off, and many other perks. Come join our fast-growing team at our headquarters in heart of Chicago.<p><br></p>We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, native origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: ETL Developer - Remote
description: Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.<p><br></p>It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<p><br></p><em><strong>Summary: </strong></em><p><br></p>It’s not just about your career or your job title. It’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to do things that haven’t been done to make your life and someone else’s life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale. This position will be working hands-on within an AWS Cloud technical domain. You will work within a multi-cloud infrastructure environment on highly complex projects, as a key member of the Platform team across the organization.<p><br></p><strong><em>Duties and Responsibilities:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Review and develop architectural requirements and communicate them within the product portfolio or team</li><li>Advocate for a “cloud smart” enterprise environment where we optimize design for both on-premise and cloud use cases</li><li>Contribute to the development of infrastructure as code with integrated testing and deployment pipelines</li><li>Design and deploy standardized solutions with end to end automation for secure and regulatory compliant application environments</li><li>Enable multi-cloud solutions with AWS and Azure clouds using standard tools and processes for best fit applications deployments</li><li>Participate in the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry and market trends to assist in project development and operational support</li><li>Engage with internal consumers of the cloud infrastructure to enable cloud adoption, hybrid solutions and full application migrations<br></li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or "STEM" majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) or 3+ years of AWS enterprise build experience</li><li>Minimum 1- 3 years’ experience in infrastructure architecture or relevant discipline</li><li>Direct experience with administration, building, and/or supporting AWS</li><li>AWS Certification<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:<br></em></strong><ul><li>Enterprise-scale experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management</li><li>Broad hands-on experience across AWS services, with deeper expertise in the following areas/services:</li><ul><li>IAM administration and policy writing (with a strong understanding of The Principle of Least Privilege)</li><li>AWS Organizations for a large multi-account corporate environment</li><li>Managing guardrails for AWS Organization Units with SCP</li><li>Strong understanding of VPC network concepts such as subnets, routing, name services, security groups, etc.<br></li></ul><li>Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), version control systems (Git), and CICD pipelines (GitLab) for full lifecycle management of AWS infrastructure &amp; guardrails.</li><li>Experience and understanding of large-scale application portfolios including migration of on-premise workloads to the cloud</li><li>Deep domain expertise of cloud infrastructure solutions focusing on IaaS, business continuity, disaster recovery, security, operations excellence and standardization</li><li>One or more of the following languages: HCL, JSON, Python, Ruby, PowerShell, Bash, Node.js</li><li>Demonstrate knowledge of business' structure (P&amp;Ls) and the interplay of functions to support business goals</li><li>Applies values, business strategy, policies, precedent, and experience to make complex decisions with uncertain consequences</li><li>Challenges conventional thinking and traditional ways of operating and invites stakeholders to identify issues and opportunities<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Physical Demands:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Requires daily interaction with Team members on meeting calls or in person</li><li>Requires sitting or standing in cubical and meeting rooms</li><li>Employee is regularly required to look at computer screen<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Work Environment: </em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The employee will normally work in a temperature-controlled office environment, with frequent exposure to electronic office equipment. Any disagreeable conditions are generally absent<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Relocation Assistance not provided<p><br></p>Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: ETL Developer
description: Salary: $110k-$120k<p><br></p>Location: East Chicago, IN<p><br></p>*Hybrid role. Must live within 1 hr. distance for occasional in-office travel*<p><br></p>*This role is unable to provide sponsorship*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field.</li><li>3-5 years of enterprise IT security engineering experience</li><li>Knowledge of security and control frameworks, such as ISO 17799, COBIT, and NIST CyberSecurity Framework.</li><li>Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP), CompTIA Security+, or GIAC Security Essentials Certification (GSEC) certification required or must be obtained within 2 years of hire.</li><li>Experience with ProofPoint, Cisco AMP, SpecOps and other industry standard security tools.</li><li>Experience with Palo Alto Firewalls</li><li>Advanced knowledge of Network Security, Endpoint Security, Server hardening, patching, and base-lining, Mobile device security, Data Loss Prevention, IDS/IPS, Log analysis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco ISE or NAC experience</li><li>Scripting (Python, Perl, Powershell) knowledge</li><li>CISSP</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain and implement the cybersecurity infrastructure and program</li><li>Collaborate with other technical teams to respond to threats as well as on a daily basis to maintain the security posture of the environment.</li><li>Work on highly complex projects and maintains knowledge across multiple domains (networking, server, end points, mobile, cloud, etc.)</li><li>Involved in patching, maintaining Firewalls, scanning for vulnerabilities, keeping current on the latest security threats and trends, and reviewing technical architecture for security compliance</li></ul>

title: Solutions Engineer
description: <strong><u>About LanzaTech</u></strong><p><br></p>LanzaTech is turning our global carbon crisis into a feedstock opportunity with the potential to displace 30% of crude oil use today and reduce global CO2 emissions by 10%. LanzaTech’s carbon recycling technology is like retrofitting a brewery onto an emission source like a steel mill, but instead of using sugars and yeast to make beer, bacteria convert pollution to products! Imagine a day when you can power a plane by recycled carbon emissions, when your yoga pants or sneakers started life as pollution from a steel mill. This future is possible using LanzaTech technology. The first commercial facility is operating in China with Shougang converting steel mill emissions to ethanol. Additional commercial facilities are in development in Belgium with the world’s largest steel maker, ArcelorMittal, in India with Indian Oil using refinery offgases, in South Africa with Swayana, using ferroalloy offgases and using agricultural residues with ethanol producer, Aemetis in California. LanzaTech has already produced synthetic jet fuel from recycled carbon emissions and the world first flight using recycled carbon took place in October 2018 when Virgin Atlantic flew a Boeing 747 from Orlando, Florida to London, UK.<p><br></p>In 2019 LanzaTech was listed in FastCompany’s Top 50 Innovative Companies at #27 and #1 in the Energy Category. In 2018 and 2017, LanzaTech was recognized as the #1 Hottest company in the Advanced Bioeconomy by Biofuels Digest, the world’s most widely-read bioeconomy daily. In 2017 the company was also inaugurated into the Cleantech100 Hall of Fame, having been listed in the top 100 cleantech companies over the last 7 years. In 2016, the company won the Young Global Leader Award for Circular Economy at the World Economic Forum, LanzaTech was also the top biofuels company in the 2018 and 2016 CNBC Disruptor 50 Companies list. In 2015, LanzaTech was awarded the U.S. EPA Presidential Green Chemistry Award for Greener Synthetic Pathways. The company’s accomplishments were recognized through a number of prestigious awards in 2014, including the Guardian Sustainable Business Innovation Award for Carbon and Energy Management, Breakthrough Innovation Award at the Platts Global Metals Awards, and the Technical Development Award from the World Petroleum Council. In 2013, the company was named a World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Global Services Engineer – A role with up to 90% travel, this position includes responsibility for all phases of process design work for commercial projects supporting our customers across various industries. This includes developing heat and weight balances, equipment sizing and specification, and developing PFDs and P&amp;IDs for engineering packages. It also includes working in the field with diverse environments and being part of or leading a start-up team. This role will also provide mentoring to all engineering disciplines assigned to projects.<p><br></p>As part of this role, work will also include working on mobile gas fermentation operations globally, including serving as analytics operator to perform demonstration-scale gas fermentations at industrial sites of potential future customers. The role will involve operating a self-contained mobile gas fermentation apparatus showing gas fermentation compatibility with industrial process gases. Engagements will take place at industrial locations throughout India such as steel mills, chemical plants, or syngas facilities.<p><br></p>These above roles will require a high-level of flexibility, communication, and resourcefulness. There will be an expectation to work weekdays and/or weekends as well as holidays, as needed. Additionally, working independently in a fast-paced, multitasking environment is also required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Function &amp; Major Activities</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Global Services Engineer:</strong>   <ul><li>Advise and assist on-site on the commissioning of newly constructed plants (including overseeing mechanical completion, leading on punch list requirements and resolution, pre-commissioning, dry, wet &amp; product commissioning, performance testing, and training)</li><li>Troubleshoot routine problems in licensed units</li><li>Prepare training material content for licensees</li><li>Visit licensees (both billable and non-billable) and prepare trip call reports. Communicate while at licensee’s site via electronic site log.</li><li>Prepare Operating Manuals for standard technology projects and review standard design packages for operability. Supervise Operating Manual translation, as required.</li><li>Assist in the creation, maintenance, and approvals of Global Services infrastructure, which includes tools, templates, standards, guidelines, and lessons learned.</li><li>Participate in the following project activities internally and with the licensee:</li><ul><li>P&amp;ID Reviews</li><li>3-D Model Reviews</li><li>Project Turnover Meeting</li></ul><li>Be proficient in completing all engineering project deliverables for which Global Services is accountable</li><li>Participate in Safety and Quality audits, as assigned</li><li>Prepare Performance Test Plans and tabulate results. Assist in solving all issues that occur during pre-commissioning, startup and performance test.</li><li>Provide quotations for billable projects (post start-up).</li><li>Interact with third parties such as equipment vendors, Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractors and industry consultants</li><li>Ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction by:</li><ul><li>Timely communication and responses to licensee issues and requests</li><li>Distributing advisories on proper operation and the advancement of the technology</li><li>Providing lab results and recommendations to customers in a timely manner</li></ul><li>Submit Corrective Action Reports for improvements through corrective or preventive actions</li><li>Interact with internal customers (i.e. Projects, E&amp;D, and Business Development) on customer issues</li><li>Own, maintain, and update Global Services licensee information and communications, as provided in the Customer Database</li><li>Train and certify new Global Service Engineers</li><li>Monitor equipment and performance warranties and guarantees. Report issues to management in a timely manner</li><li>Work with plant operating personnel to troubleshoot plant operation issues</li><li>Develop and share best practices with the engineering and science teams throughout the company</li><li>Assist in training client operations teams onsite to be independent with operations</li><li>Achieve individual performance goals that are assigned by your manager</li><li>Develop preliminary scope and project plan for new bioprocesses projects including estimates for preliminary project costs and benefits</li><li>Integrate LanzaTech fermentation process with supporting technologies to develop a complete technology package</li><li>Accountable for basic engineering packages which includes, but is not limited to:</li><ul><li>Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs)</li><li>Detailed Heat and Weight Balances for new or modified processes</li><li>Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&amp;IDs)</li><li>Equipment lists and specifications</li><li>Respond to client needs in a timely manner with technically sound positions</li></ul><li>Utilize specified software, models and LanzaTech proprietary tools to size equipment.</li><li>Validate calculations, heat and weight balances data, equipment sizing and equipment specification information pre-packaged by other Process Engineers.</li><li>Work with plant operating personnel to troubleshoot operation issues.</li><li>Interact with third parties such as equipment vendors, Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractors and industry consultants.</li><li>Participate in or lead process HAZOPs and risk identification and mitigation activities.</li><li>Develop and share best practices with the engineering team and throughout the company.</li><li>Prepare accurate calculations, some of which are non-standard.</li><li>Lead in the continuous improvement effort of LanzaTech’s design methodologies and tools to address customers’ needs and the productivity within LanzaTech.</li><li>Provide R&amp;D, sales and Technical Services support, as required.</li><li>Achieve individual performance goals that are assigned by your manager.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Mobile Gas Fermentation Operator</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Install and operate mobile gas fermentation equipment to perform microbial gas fermentation: CIP, media preparation and other chemical stock solutions, routine sample preparation and analysis, pH probe calibration, prepare tubing assemblies, gas plumbing</li><li>Interact with clients on a technical and scientific level, and engage potential customers to cultivate and inspire working relationships</li><li>Assist in experimental design</li><li>Coordinate fermentation runs and sample analysis with remote staff in Skokie, IL</li><li>Maintain and evaluate fermentation data in database</li><li>Prepare and present results, scientific findings, technical reports, and protocols</li><li>Install and trouble-shoot equipment</li><li>Manage chemicals, consumables, and equipment inventory including stocking and purchase orders</li><li>Maintain safe practices and work environment, and contribute to and adhere to all safety standards and practices</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Critical Results</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves individual performance goals that are set by the manager(s).</li><li>Prioritizes, organizes &amp; efficiently completes daily work requirements from ever-changing external and internal customer inquiries and demands</li><li>Prepares accurate calculations, some of which are non-standard, as required and on-time and within budget</li><li>Completes quality checking, as required on customer deliverables and within budget and schedule</li><li>Proactively contributes to the continuous improvement effort of LanzaTech’s document deliverables and process designs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering</li><li>5+ years of experience in the position offered demonstrated experience with developing description_json: <strong><u>About LanzaTech</u></strong><p><br></p>LanzaTech is turning our global carbon crisis into a feedstock opportunity with the potential to displace 30% of crude oil use today and reduce global CO2 emissions by 10%. LanzaTech’s carbon recycling technology is like retrofitting a brewery onto an emission source like a steel mill, but instead of using sugars and yeast to make beer, bacteria convert pollution to products! Imagine a day when you can power a plane by recycled carbon emissions, when your yoga pants or sneakers started life as pollution from a steel mill. This future is possible using LanzaTech technology. The first commercial facility is operating in China with Shougang converting steel mill emissions to ethanol. Additional commercial facilities are in development in Belgium with the world’s largest steel maker, ArcelorMittal, in India with Indian Oil using refinery offgases, in South Africa with Swayana, using ferroalloy offgases and using agricultural residues with ethanol producer, Aemetis in California. LanzaTech has already produced synthetic jet fuel from recycled carbon emissions and the world first flight using recycled carbon took place in October 2018 when Virgin Atlantic flew a Boeing 747 from Orlando, Florida to London, UK.<p><br></p>In 2019 LanzaTech was listed in FastCompany’s Top 50 Innovative Companies at #27 and #1 in the Energy Category. In 2018 and 2017, LanzaTech was recognized as the #1 Hottest company in the Advanced Bioeconomy by Biofuels Digest, the world’s most widely-read bioeconomy daily. In 2017 the company was also inaugurated into the Cleantech100 Hall of Fame, having been listed in the top 100 cleantech companies over the last 7 years. In 2016, the company won the Young Global Leader Award for Circular Economy at the World Economic Forum, LanzaTech was also the top biofuels company in the 2018 and 2016 CNBC Disruptor 50 Companies list. In 2015, LanzaTech was awarded the U.S. EPA Presidential Green Chemistry Award for Greener Synthetic Pathways. The company’s accomplishments were recognized through a number of prestigious awards in 2014, including the Guardian Sustainable Business Innovation Award for Carbon and Energy Management, Breakthrough Innovation Award at the Platts Global Metals Awards, and the Technical Development Award from the World Petroleum Council. In 2013, the company was named a World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Global Services Engineer – A role with up to 90% travel, this position includes responsibility for all phases of process design work for commercial projects supporting our customers across various industries. This includes developing heat and weight balances, equipment sizing and specification, and developing PFDs and P&amp;IDs for engineering packages. It also includes working in the field with diverse environments and being part of or leading a start-up team. This role will also provide mentoring to all engineering disciplines assigned to projects.<p><br></p>As part of this role, work will also include working on mobile gas fermentation operations globally, including serving as analytics operator to perform demonstration-scale gas fermentations at industrial sites of potential future customers. The role will involve operating a self-contained mobile gas fermentation apparatus showing gas fermentation compatibility with industrial process gases. Engagements will take place at industrial locations throughout India such as steel mills, chemical plants, or syngas facilities.<p><br></p>These above roles will require a high-level of flexibility, communication, and resourcefulness. There will be an expectation to work weekdays and/or weekends as well as holidays, as needed. Additionally, working independently in a fast-paced, multitasking environment is also required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Function &amp; Major Activities</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Global Services Engineer:</strong>   <ul><li>Advise and assist on-site on the commissioning of newly constructed plants (including overseeing mechanical completion, leading on punch list requirements and resolution, pre-commissioning, dry, wet &amp; product commissioning, performance testing, and training)</li><li>Troubleshoot routine problems in licensed units</li><li>Prepare training material content for licensees</li><li>Visit licensees (both billable and non-billable) and prepare trip call reports. Communicate while at licensee’s site via electronic site log.</li><li>Prepare Operating Manuals for standard technology projects and review standard design packages for operability. Supervise Operating Manual translation, as required.</li><li>Assist in the creation, maintenance, and approvals of Global Services infrastructure, which includes tools, templates, standards, guidelines, and lessons learned.</li><li>Participate in the following project activities internally and with the licensee:</li><ul><li>P&amp;ID Reviews</li><li>3-D Model Reviews</li><li>Project Turnover Meeting</li></ul><li>Be proficient in completing all engineering project deliverables for which Global Services is accountable</li><li>Participate in Safety and Quality audits, as assigned</li><li>Prepare Performance Test Plans and tabulate results. Assist in solving all issues that occur during pre-commissioning, startup and performance test.</li><li>Provide quotations for billable projects (post start-up).</li><li>Interact with third parties such as equipment vendors, Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractors and industry consultants</li><li>Ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction by:</li><ul><li>Timely communication and responses to licensee issues and requests</li><li>Distributing advisories on proper operation and the advancement of the technology</li><li>Providing lab results and recommendations to customers in a timely manner</li></ul><li>Submit Corrective Action Reports for improvements through corrective or preventive actions</li><li>Interact with internal customers (i.e. Projects, E&amp;D, and Business Development) on customer issues</li><li>Own, maintain, and update Global Services licensee information and communications, as provided in the Customer Database</li><li>Train and certify new Global Service Engineers</li><li>Monitor equipment and performance warranties and guarantees. Report issues to management in a timely manner</li><li>Work with plant operating personnel to troubleshoot plant operation issues</li><li>Develop and share best practices with the engineering and science teams throughout the company</li><li>Assist in training client operations teams onsite to be independent with operations</li><li>Achieve individual performance goals that are assigned by your manager</li><li>Develop preliminary scope and project plan for new bioprocesses projects including estimates for preliminary project costs and benefits</li><li>Integrate LanzaTech fermentation process with supporting technologies to develop a complete technology package</li><li>Accountable for basic engineering packages which includes, but is not limited to:</li><ul><li>Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs)</li><li>Detailed Heat and Weight Balances for new or modified processes</li><li>Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&amp;IDs)</li><li>Equipment lists and specifications</li><li>Respond to client needs in a timely manner with technically sound positions</li></ul><li>Utilize specified software, models and LanzaTech proprietary tools to size equipment.</li><li>Validate calculations, heat and weight balances data, equipment sizing and equipment specification information pre-packaged by other Process Engineers.</li><li>Work with plant operating personnel to troubleshoot operation issues.</li><li>Interact with third parties such as equipment vendors, Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractors and industry consultants.</li><li>Participate in or lead process If you’re looking to get on the ground floor of the next digital revolution and Chicago tech success story – this opportunity may be for you.<p><br></p>As a Back End Developer with Cooler Screens, you will use your experience to help us reimagine the digital in-store shopper experience. You will be working within the software engineering team to help create our in-store IoT solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are passionate about development and eager to expand your knowledge within a fast-paced start-up environment.</li><li>You are an innovator who thrives on tough technical challenges and finds ways to apply technology to solve business problems.</li><li>You’ll work directly with proven leaders as an integral part of the development and growth of our company. Our digital- and design-led culture allows you to think creatively, challenge the status quo, and use your abilities to change the face of retail forever. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience in a full-time development role</li><li>Proven experience with back-end languages such as Node.js, Java, or C#</li><li>Solid understanding of database systems such as Microsoft SQL or CosmosDB</li><li>B.S. preferred, in Computer Science or related discipline</li><li>Azure platform experience preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Cooler Screens</u></strong><p><br></p>We are transforming retail cooler surfaces into IoT-enabled screens. Our media platform reimagines the brick-and-mortar shopping experience for consumers in the cooler and freezer aisle while delivering new marketing opportunities and smart merchandising for brands and retailers.<p><br></p>We have an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paidtime off, and many other perks. title: Global Services Engineer
description: <strong>Together, we can beat cancer.</strong><p><br></p>At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.<p><br></p>We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.<p><br></p>If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.<p><br></p>To provide operational, technical support, maintenance, and customer service to the delivery of Proton Therapy<p><br></p>Provides highly visible customer support through the performance of on-site installation of proton therapy equipment and ancillary devices, as well as overseeing any necessary diagnoses, troubleshooting, service, and repair of complex equipment and systems. Checks out and approves operational quality of system equipment. Instructs customers in the operation and maintenance of the system. Serves as company liaison with customer on administrative and technical matters for assigned projects. Interprets customers’ needs and clarifies if the responsibility for problem resolution falls to sales personnel, customer support reps, or engineers. This job may include any aspect of field support, and is not limited to system hardware and software, PCs, and networking/wireless networking. Installs and upgrades a wide range of company products according to technical documentation and company guidelines to ensure that customer’s equipment operates efficiently. Demonstrates to customer equipment operation and specification according to Customer Acceptance Procedure (CAP). Instructs customers in operation and basic maintenance of VMS products. Works in small teams, and requires a minimum of supervision. Applicable to the Oncology Systems business only: Position must have full access to VMS client sites to perform the essential functions of this position. Many VMS clients require VMS employees and representatives to meet certain “Vendor Credentialing” requirements before they will be allowed to have access to their sites. Unless prohibited by law, position must meet all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to have full client access, and must continue to meet those requirements during the course of VMS employment in this position. May be required to specialize in specific technical areas and have some level of cross-functional and overall system knowledge. Work at customer sites long term (up to 2+ years) depending on the project needs and scope. Conduct the Acceptance Conditions testing, to ensure that all installation conditions will be met according to schedule and that customers can sign the Acceptance Letters. Input detailed records of installation and upgrade work performed into company information systems to ensure accurate updated customer installation information is available to other VMS functions. Maintain a high degree of professional knowledge and safety consciousness according to VMS guidelines in order to perform activities under the safest working conditions. Performs parts inventory and ordering for assigned installation, including replenishing spare parts kit, short shipment and return consigned parts appropriately and in a timely manner per procedure as necessary for each install. Maintain technical documentation regarding operating characteristics, design factors, technical performance and development of products to improve installation efficiency. Report by means of FSR’s, time sheets, expense reports, etc. regularly to ensure accurate company statistical data on customer-oriented activities is available. Advise less experienced Installation Representatives in technical matters.<p><br></p>Minimum Required Skills and Knowledge: Knowledge of and sound professional experience with electronic and electro-mechanical engineering, testing equipment used for verification, checkout and calibration of electronic and/or mechanical equipment. Knowledge of and professional technical experience with micro-computers/PC based systems Customer focused attitude Articulate and skilled in interpersonal communication Fluency in English, both written and spoken Other Desired Skills and Knowledge: Sound computer usage and debugging skills Sound knowledge of networks and networking techniques Sound understanding of imaging systems Fluency in German, both written and spoken Required Certifications and Training: Obtains and completes LMS training plan specific to assigned responsibility. Applicable to the Oncology Systems business only: Meets all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to gain VMS client site access, unless prohibited by law. These requirements vary by client and may include, but are not limited to: Proof of valid identification (photo, driver’s license, SSN) Criminal background checks Drug screens Immunizations (Hep B, MMR, Varicella, Influenza, Tetanus) Annual TB testing Healthcare trainings Experience Level with Business Tools: Familiar with business tools such as: E-mail, Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Experience with HCM (e.g., Workday) or equivalent ERP product and productivity software desired. High School Degree or equivalent 2 – 3 years of related experience<p><br></p>Position must have full access to Varian client sites to perform the essential functions of this position. Many clients require Varian employees and representatives to meet certain Vendor Credentialing requirements before they will be allowed to have access to their sites. Unless prohibited by law, position must meet all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to have full client access and must continue to meet those requirements during the course of employment in this position. These requirements vary by client and may include, but are not limited to: Proof of valid identification (photo, driver's license, SSN) Criminal background checks Drug screens Immunizations (COVID-19, Hep B, MMR, Varicella, Influenza, Tetanus) Annual TB testing Healthcare training<p><br></p><strong>Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.</strong><p><br></p>We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.<p><br></p><strong>#TogetherWeFight</strong><p><br></p>Privacy Statement<p><br></p>The base pay range for this position is<p><br></p>Min $59,400 - Max $101,000<p><br></p>The pay wage range shown is based on the job posting's primary location. Actual compensation packages are based on a wide array of factors, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications, and location.
