title: ETL Developer
description: Precise Solutions is an Illinois BEP/FBE (female owned business enterprise) certified consulting company founded in 2000. Our mission is to provide companies with specialized resources that can drive their system portfolio projects using program management processes, change management and blended learning solutions. Please visit our website at www.precise-solutions.com<p><br></p><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following</u></strong><p><br></p>At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries primarily located in the Northern Chicago Suburbs. We are much more than a consulting firm. Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and pension.<p><br></p>AWS Enterprise Cloud Operations Engineer<p><br></p>Rate: $80 hr. including benefits<p><br></p>Description The Enterprise Cloud Operations Engineer position will oversee Cloud operations to ensure the environments health, stability, manage the daily cloud based systems utilizing AWS, Azure, Oracle, and Google cloud platforms to ensure the availability, performance, scalability and security of cloud based systems. Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Oversee, participate in and manage production deployments within the various Cloud environments.</li><li>Responsible for reviewing designs, deployment, and hands-on implementation of Cloud solutions.</li><li>Strong understanding of Amazon services (IaaS, SaaS, PaaS, DBaaS).</li><li>Strong understanding of services utilized by cloud vendors (AWS, Oracle, Azure, Google). </li><li>Familiarity with Cloud Watch, Trusted Cloud Advisor, Cloud Trail, Guard Duty, Cost Explorer, Cloud Checker, Splunk, Turbot, CASB (Cloud Access Security Broker) and other cloud management tools.</li><li>Configuration and deployment experience in three or more of the following:</li><li>AWS services such as ECS, RDS, Lambda, VPC’s and S3 </li><li>Azure services such as Web/Mobile, Containers, Databases, Storage and Identity Management </li><li>Oracle services such as Bare Metal Compute, Fast Connect, Containers, Storage and Database </li><li>Participate in the Design, implementation and Operation of application and infrastructure monitoring solutions (Service Now Discovery, Splunk, Qualys). </li><li>Responsible for setting reporting standards, reporting and reviewing the cloud reports. </li><li>Monitoring, Alerting and response to alerts, making and settings standards and policies. </li><li>Review and approve strategic migration plans to move on premise applications to various cloud vendors. </li><li>Review the architectural diagrams for proposed solutions and leads the review with architecture, engineering, and operation teams. </li><li>Improve Capacity Management within the Client cloud environments. </li><li>Mentor the Operations organization and less experienced technical staff. </li><li>Service billing management. Utilize knowledge to detail cost drivers in cloud systems delivery and operations and the consequences of the technical decisions made by you and/or others. </li><li>Strong documentation skills for updating and maintaining a Knowledge Base and knowledge articles.</li><li>Establish required documentation, standards and policies. </li><li>Working knowledge and hands on experience with Service Now and ITIL change management. </li><li>Participate in onboarding systems and services within the cloud environments. </li><li>Manage security across infrastructure and applications that reside in the cloud. </li><li>Account access oversight, governance and administration. </li><li>Provides cloud governance, processes and technical advisory support to business units and projects by working cross-functionally and provide recommendations that support the business needs. </li><li>Participant as required (Level 3/escalation point) for Incident Management. </li><li>Participate and develop client relationships within Operations, Business partners, Managed Service Providers and Cloud services. </li><li>Work with cross-functional teams to support the engineering and implementation of new cloud applications or solutions, and define the related risks. </li><li>Responsible for adherence to corporate standards regarding applicable corporate and divisional Policies, including code of conduct, safety, GxP compliance, and data security. </li><li>Regular interaction and working relationship with the Cloud engineering and architecture teams to ensure stable cloud Operations.</li><li>Participate in risk assessments and audits within the Cloud environments, provide required evidence and findings. </li><li>Participate in all aspects of Disaster Recovery as it related to the Cloud environment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>AWS Certified Solutions Architect (Strongly preferred), AWS Certified Solutions Associate, AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner. </li><li>Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) or Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) desired. PowerShell scripting a plus. </li><li>RHEL Certification desired. Advanced knowledge preferred in Linux and System Administration tasks including OS installation, configuration, troubleshooting and management. Linux User Management, Log Analysis, resource utilization and fine tuning. Good knowledge of scripting languages (Python, Ruby, etc.) Experience working with configuration management tools (Ansible). </li><li>Oracle Cloud Application Foundation Essentials or Oracle Exalogic Elastic Cloud Implementation desired. </li><li>Strong understanding of network and firewall principles and cloud virtualization environments such as AWS. </li><li>Docker and/or Kubernetes Experience a plus. </li><li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Deployment Pipelines a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p>Basic <ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent education in Technology related field with extensive (typically 8-12 years) of related work; Technical background in healthcare or companies is preferred. </li><li>Established experience in Cloud Service development, compute engineering, automation, orchestration, architecture and implementation </li><li>Strong background in Operations and/or Infrastructure Engineering. </li><li>Strong background in Linux/Unix and/or Windows administration. </li><li>Interacts well with diverse groups within function and maintains strong working relationships with internal and external entities. </li><li>Background in regulated companies a plus (pharmaceutical, healthcare, financial institutions or similar). </li><li>Ability to influence others in the technology areas. </li><li>Advanced Knowledge of Cloud and Open Source Technologies such as: Service Discovery, Networking, Load Balancing, Containers, Deployment and Scaling, Fault Tolerance and throttling, failure domains and zones, etc. </li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Salesforce Developer
description: <strong>SQL Developer with C#<br><br>Location: Chicago, IL(Hybrid)<br><br>Interview: Phone + Skype<br><br></strong><strong>JD:<br><br></strong>Tech stack is C#, SQL Server, SQL, SSIS, Angular (a plus), WebAPI, WCF, Web Services.<br><br>Involve in the phases of software Life Cycle Development.<br><br>Analyze, design, develop, implement and test applications.<br><br>Design and develop user interfaces of application modules.<br><br>Develop build scripts and deploy the application.<br><br>Participate in code integration and system testing. Create unit test cases and test the application.<br><br>Uses the Agile/ Scrum model as part of the daily and sprint work routine, updating, user stories, tasks and Defects statues in Rally and Participates in team huddles to update the code development, deployment, and test automation status of the application.<br><br>Participate in requirements discussion with business to provide inputs on feasibility of implementation based on application architecture.<br><br>Responsible for requirement gathering, development/ enhancement of application framework<br><br>Design databases, tables and Indexes.<br><br>Create many stored procedures with input and output parameters to be utilized by micro services.<br><br>Develop SQL Queries to fetch complex data from different tables in remote databases using joins, and database links.<br><br>Create Custom SSIS Packages using C# in Script task to handle issues related to excel and flat files and to send custom emails to users.<br><br>Implement data validation rules in SSIS Packages. Deployed individual packages created environmental variables and scheduled jobs. Created packages in SSIS with error handling.<br><br>Utilize business intelligence reports daily, hourly and on-demand basis by using the Data Gateways as necessary.<br><br>Design complex data intensive reports and visualizations utilizing various graph features such as gauge, funnel, line for better business analysis.<br><br>Aggregate Functions, Filter Functions, Time &amp; Date Functions and Logical Functions in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) for various fact calculations and efficient data visualization.<br><br>Host and consume RESTful Web services using API .<br><br>Develop Micro services using RESTful services to provide all the CRUD capabilities.<br><br>Develop Restful Web Services for applications to allow external applications to access data and also to consume external services.<br><br>Test and debug program units in conjunction with other units and/or systems.<br><br>Test SQL databases and perform bug fixes.<br><br>Develop User Interface (UI) and Application Program Interface (API) automated tests that adhere to the coding standards by frequently analyzing the repository with Sonar Lint and SonarQube servers to determine the quality gate.<br><br>Triages application defects for all that impact test case automation execution and delivery, and work on the Critical Production Issues on Priority basis.<br><br>Configure fiddler for auto-generated documentation for all REST API calls.<br><br>Document web application test results for dynamic test elements, functional tests, and document object model (DOM)<br><br><strong>Navnish kumar<br><br></strong><u> IT Technical Recruiter <br><br></u><strong> Stellent IT </strong><strong> Phone <u> : <br><br><strong> Email: navnish</strong></u></strong>

title: Natural Language Processing Data Scientist
description: Dealer eProcess is looking for a LOCAL Front-End Object-Oriented PHP Developer who thrives in a high energy, fast-paced environment to join our growing team.<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced HTML5, CSS3, Javascript</li><li>Ability to convert mockups into functional website</li><li>Basic to intermediate PHP with understanding of PHP frameworks and ability to navigate through application files</li><li>Great attention to detail</li><li>Experience building mobile-friendly responsive websites (with only HTML/CSS/JS, no bootstrap or other frameworks)</li><li>Understanding of browser and device compatibility</li><li>Adhere to coding standards to write code that is understandable by everyone on the team</li><li>Actively contribute opinions on responsive design techniques, and progressive enhancement</li><li>Confidence in styling dynamic content</li><li>Ability to optimize site performance</li><li>Ability to troublshoot issues across sites and technologies to identify root cause among widely varying scenarios (both proactively and reactively)</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Works well with minimum supervision</li><li>Focus on high quality results</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Bonus, Not Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Require JS (AMD Modules)</li><li>Object Oriented experience</li><li>Experience using GIT</li><li>Composer</li><li>Javascript framework experience (Angular, Vue, React, etc)</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Back End Developer
description: <strong>Status:</strong> Full-time, exempt<br><br><strong>Schedule:</strong> M-F, 8.30a.m. - 4.30p.m, 37.5 hours per week including occasional evening and weekend work and/or travel based on business needs/position requirements. This may include working beyond core hours based on the essential duties and responsibilities of the position.<br><br><strong>Reports to:</strong> Director, IT Operations and Cloud Infrastructure<br><br><strong>Direct reports:</strong> Helpdesk Team - 3<br><br><strong>Start date: </strong>ASAP<br><br><strong>Location:</strong> While IES Abroad is headquartered in Chicago, the IT DevOps Engineer will work out of his or her home office or work out of IES Abroad headquarters in Chicago, as required.<br><br><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>Everything we do is about the IES Abroad student. Our profoundly passionate team of study abroad professionals believe in creating once-in-a-lifetime educational adventures that transcend expectations. Our goal is to rock the world of some 9,500 study abroad students every year.<br><br>From our headquarters in Chicago to our 400+ study abroad programs in 85 global locations worldwide, we create authentic global education and life-affirming cultural experiences. We work at IES Abroad because we believe that every student should have the opportunity to go abroad - especially in a fun, safe, and superior academic and cultural environment.<br><br>We believe so strongly in the power of our program, that we actively recruit students from underrepresented populations and provide millions in scholarships and aid year after year. We are proud that our students are as diverse and exciting as the countries we study.<br><br>We're not ashamed to admit, we're a little bit obsessed with study abroad.<br><br>When you join IES Abroad, you are a part of a diverse community of global leaders who know that our differences in skills and backgrounds are just as important as our shared passions and mission. Our work to educate students to become global leaders is grounded in our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and anti-racism. We are a global organization made up of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, and we are committed to creating an inclusive, welcoming environment for all employees, surrounded by a mix of talented professionals. You'll want to come to work and, more importantly, want to stay and advance our mission together.<br><br><strong><u>Summary Of Position<br><br></u></strong>Under direction of the Director of IT Operations, the IT DevOps Engineer will be responsible for consultation, analysis, planning, testing, integration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of IT infrastructure and cloud assets. The IT DevOps Engineer also serves as an escalation to the Helpdesk when needed. The IT DevOps Engineer works with IES Abroad's IT Managed Service Provider and other third party vendors to implement all required cloud infrastructure and maintenance.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Job Responsibilities &amp; Duties</u></strong><ul><li>IT Infrastructure:</li><ul><li>Proactively seeks to prevent problems or issues from arising by working with in house staff and third-party vendors.</li><li>Manage deployment, automation, management, and maintenance of cloud production system.</li><li>Troubleshooting and problem resolution across application domains and platforms.</li><li>Partner with the other IT Teams to manage and implement new technologies leveraging cloud computing services.</li><li>Work closely with the IT Development team to optimize and manage the CI/CD system.</li><li>Coordinate with network and client services team to deliver cloud services for on-premise network and client equipment.</li><li>Perform yearly disaster recovery testing and keep documentation for recovery plans updated.</li></ul><li>Other duties:</li><ul><li>Commit to and demonstrate values and promotion of diversity, equity, inclusion, and anti-racism.</li><li>Attend meetings and serve on committees and task forces, as requested.</li><li>Maintain knowledge of changes and updates in AWS and other cloud providers.</li><li>Understands key business drivers and applies the knowledge of internal/external business issues to improve products and services.</li><li>Participates in the review of failures and provides feedback to prevent future occurrences.</li><li>Document specific duties, activities, problems solved and issues resolved.</li><li>Training seminars and in-service training sessions.</li><li>Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of this position.</li><li>Any other task or duty as assigned or required.<br></li></ul></ul><strong><u>Experience &amp; Qualifications/Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Deep knowledge of AWS and other cloud computing systems.</li><li>Ability to demonstrate values and promotion of diversity, equity, inclusion, and anti-racism required.</li><li>Ability to implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies on AWS</li><li>Must be able to evaluate critical systems, prioritize workflow and determine solutions.</li><li>Knowledge in Infrastructure-as-Code tools like Terraform, Packer, Ansible.</li><li>Working knowledge of IT security best practices as it relates to cloud computing platforms.</li><li>Ability to define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems on AWS.</li><li>Experience with containerization in AWS or other cloud service.</li><li>Working knowledge of AWS networking.</li><li>Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Must be able to read and understand technical manuals.</li><li>Must be able to work for extended time at keyboard/terminal.</li><li>Maintain professional and effective working relationships with supervisor and coworkers.</li><li>Must be able to work flexible hours, including weekends and evenings, participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation.</li><li>Must be able to learn new skills and technologies.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education, Licenses And/or Certifications Etc<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Information Services, or related field or five years' of equivalent experience working in a large cloud environment designing and analyzing IT systems.</li><li>AWS certifications preferred.<br></li></ul><strong><u>How To Apply<br><br></u></strong>All applicants should submit an application including <strong>cover letter, resume, and salary requirements</strong> by clicking 'Apply Now' at the right side of this page. Please visit www.IESabroad.org/jobs for more information about working at IES Abroad. If you require an accommodation with the application process, please email IESAbroad-Careers@iesabroad.org.<br><br><strong><u>Equal Opportunity Employment<br><br></u></strong>IES Abroad is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. We strive to treat people with respect; fully utilizing employee's abilities and promoting workforce diversity.<br><br>We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and do not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin, citizenship, religion, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, and/or any other status protected by applicable laws.<br><br><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>

title: ETL Developer
description: <strong><u>About Our Teams</u></strong><p><br></p>At Tempus, products are owned and developed by small, autonomous teams composed of developers, designers, scientists, and product managers. You and your team set the goals, build the software, deploy the code, and contribute to a growing software platform that will make a lasting impact in the field of cancer research and treatment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Why We’re Looking For You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You've got software development experience in both frontend and backend technologies.</li><li>You're familiar with some of the technologies we use, such as: Node.js, React.js, Angular.js, Java, Python, MySQL, Postgres, REST, and GraphQL.</li><li>You've worked in agile environments and are comfortable iterating quickly.</li><li>You enjoy collaborating and communicating with team members of varying skill sets and from different fields.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Bonus Points For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in Docker</li><li>Experience in AWS</li><li>Experience in Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, etc.</li><li>An interest in working in biotech, genomics, and precision medicine</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Tempus</u></strong><p><br></p>Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?<p><br></p>We're on a mission to connect an entire ecosystem to redefine how genomic data is used in clinical settings. We're looking for software engineers who are passionate about changing the status quo and bringing cancer care into the 21st century.<p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Field Service Engineer
description: <p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span><br> <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><u>SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:</u><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>This position has responsibility for analysis of </span><span>the </span><span>reliability and validation of new and existing products as well as the ability to manage multiple projects and work with customer test specification inquiries. Creation of new test methods using EE, software and Mechanical skills.<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><u>SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES<br><br></u></p><ul><li><span>Establish and perform product qualifications and reliability tests to determine product reliability</span></li><li><span>Schedule and organize qualification and ongoing reliability testing in our global facilities.</span></li><li><span>Must be able to comprehend specification documentation </span></li><li><span>Recommend and drive test improvements and new test methods</span></li><li><span>Preparation of technical reports for internal and external customers.</span></li><li><span>Apply reliability statistical techniques in test design and in data analysis.</span><span> </span></li><li><span>Review customers’ test specifications and develop test plans to meet their requirements.</span></li><li><span>Facilitate customer inquiries involving product Reliability</span></li><li><span>Communicate test results and issues to the project team and our customers </span></li><li><span>Develops new tests as it relates to new product technologies</span></li><li><span>Manage multiple projects at a given time an</span><span>d</span><span> communicate status and roadblocks as required.  Must be able to quickly manage and adapt to project changes made by the team and our customers.  </span></li></ul><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><u>POSITION/TRAINING REQUIREMENTS</u><span>: <br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Successful candidate will possess a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical</span><span> Engineering, </span><span>Electrical Engineering, or equivalent with </span><span>2-5</span><span> years </span><span>of </span><span>related experience. </span></li><li><span>Experience in a reliability/quality engineering position  </span></li><li><span>Knowledge of Electronics and Electrical Components, Statistical Techniques, Design of Experiments</span></li><li><span>Must be experienced in the use of Excel, Minitab, LabVIEW and Weibull </span></li><li><span>Must possess excellent technical writing and project management skills with the ability to provide reports for direct customer consumption. CRE a plus</span><span>,</span><span> must possess basic knowledge of reliability methods and applications.</span></li><li><span>Candidate must be detail oriented.  </span></li><li><span>Minimal overseas travel required.                       </span></li></ul><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><u>REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:<br><br></u></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>Reports to:</span><span></span><span>Global Reliability Lab Manager <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>Supervises:</span><span></span><span>Technicians<br><br> <br><br></span></p><p><strong><u><span>COMPANY DESCRIPTION:<br><br></span></u></strong></p><p><span>Knowles is a market leader and global provider of advanced micro-acoustic microphones and balanced armature speakers, audio solutions, and high performance capacitors and radio frequency ("RF") filtering products, serving the medtech, defense, consumer electronics, electric vehicle, industrial, and communications markets. Our focus on the customer, combined with unique technology, proprietary manufacturing techniques, and global operational expertise, enables us to deliver innovative solutions across multiple applications. Knowles, founded in 1946 and headquartered in Itasca, Illinois, has approximately 7,000 employees at facilities located in 13 countries around the world.<br><br></span></p><p><span> </span><span>At Knowles, we are committed to engineering a better tomorrow through the actions we take on a daily basis. We believe that our focus on ethical, socially responsible, and environmentally sustainable behavior guides our decision-making processes and helps keep us accountable. Visit us at </span><span>knowles.com<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>EOE M/F/D/V<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p>

title: Developer - Big Data
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking a Kafka Cloud Engineer. Candidate will perform a range of activities required to both maintain and continuously automate a large, complex virtualization and cloud-based computing environment. In addition, you will provide technical guidance within the team on kafka and when called upon, serve as a technical liaison between internal departments. This will involve utilizing best practices for the management, architecture, configuration, DR, administration, and automation of the enterprise server virtualization environment with cloud technologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide professional input to the organization for cloud and virtualization end-to-end architecture and IaaS, as well as PaaS and SaaS solutions such as AWS RedShift</li><li>Develop and maintain a library of deployable, tested, and documented automation design scripts, processes, and procedures</li><li>Enable DevOps development activities and complex development tasks that will involve working with tools such as Docker, Kafka and container management systems</li><li>Provide advanced Kafka administrative title: AWS Enterprise Cloud Operations Engineer
description: Here at Tempus we believe the greatest promise for the detection and treatment of cancer &amp; other diseases lies in building a deep understanding of the interaction between molecular attributes and clinical treatment. With the advent of genomic sequencing, we can finally measure and process our genetic makeup. We now have more data than ever before, but providers often don't have the infrastructure or expertise required to easily extract the valuable insights that exist within this data.<p><br></p>This is a unique opportunity to expand your expertise in cancer genetics and have a direct impact on the fight against cancer. We're on a mission to redefine how genomic data is used in a clinical setting through precision medicine. We are looking for data scientists who are passionate about applying state of the art techniques to the processing and integrative analyses of vast amounts of clinical, molecular, and imaging data.<p><br></p>We are interested in a strong machine learning or statistics specialist with a strong genomics background, that is eager to learn about the recent advances in healthcare, and applying his or her skills to improve patient outcomes.<p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze and integrate large diverse clinical, molecular and imaging datasets to extract insights, and drive research opportunities.</li><li>Redefine patient cohorts for clinical and research insights.</li><li>Design and prototype novel analysis tools and algorithms.</li><li>Collaborate with product, science, engineering, and business development teams to build the most advanced data platform in precision medicine.</li><li>Interrogate analytical results for robustness, validity, and out of sample stability.</li><li>Document, summarize, and present your findings to a group of peers and stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>PhD degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistical genetics, cancer genetics, bioinformatics, statistics, computational biology, applied mathematics, or similar)</li><li>Experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms, and ensemble methods, such as: PCA, regression, deep neural networks, decision trees, gradient boosting, generalized linear models, mixed effect models, non-linear low dimensional embeddings and clustering.</li><li>Proficient in Python, SQL and Docker.</li><li>Experience with the following: Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scikit-learn, AWS and Jupyter Notebooks.</li><li>Experience working in a Linux / Mac and AWS cloud environments.</li><li>Outstanding programming and problem solving skills.</li><li>Self-driven and work well in an interdisciplinary team with minimal direction.</li><li>Thrive in a fast-paced environment and willing to shift priorities seamlessly.</li><li>Experience with communicating insights and presenting concepts to diverse audiences.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong peer-reviewed publication record.</li><li>2+ years full time employment or postdoctoral experience building and validating predictive models on structured or unstructured data.</li><li>Previous experience working with large transcriptome data sets.</li><li>Experience working with clinical and/or genomic data.</li><li>Kaggle.com competitions and/or kernels track record.</li><li>Experience with: Git, matplotlib, seaborn, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, D3, Plot.ly, Flask, Dask.</li><li>Experience in agile environments and comfort with quick iterations.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: SQL Developer with C#
description: <strong>Looking for a new LabVIEW Opportunity? </strong><p><br></p><strong>I have the one for you!</strong><p><br></p>My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics offerings for the Automotive and Transportation industry. They are looking to add an experienced Test Engineer to help test Electronics during and post manufacturing. This team develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that they build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. In this team you will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products, working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements, then write the software to implement that.<p><br></p><ul><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to</li></ul><p><br></p>meet product test requirements<p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and</li></ul><p><br></p>other continuous improvement initiatives<p><br></p><ul><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal</li></ul><p><br></p>project stakeholders<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Labview</li><li>C#</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development</li><li>Test design</li><li>Test procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Production</li><li>Manufacturing,</li><li>Lab</li><li>Validation </li><li>Test plan</li><li>Test engineering</li><li>Electrical</li><li>Test equipment</li><li>Write test scripts</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Employee Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans </li><li>Abenity Discount Program </li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance </li><li>PTO/Paid Holidays</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>5+ Years Experience<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.<p><br></p>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Front End Developer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Company Description:</strong><p><br></p>Apexon is a digital-first technology services firm backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital. We specialize in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. For over 17 years, Apexon has been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities And Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage multiple tasks and use sound judgment when prioritizing.</li><li>Collaborate with global cross functional teams in building customer-centric products.</li><li>Analyze existing software implementations to identify areas of improvement and provide deadline estimates for implementing new features.</li><li>Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices and software runbooks.</li><li>Establish trusted partnerships with peers, product heads, and executive level stakeholders.</li><li>Must be passionate about technology and engineering.</li><li>Exceptional analytical skills and ability to apply knowledge and experience in decision-making.</li><li>Ability to leverage technology to deliver business value.</li><li>Must be independent and comfortable in a fast paced, ambiguous and often multi-directional work environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills And Experience We Are Looking For</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 5 years of relevant professional experience using a modern programming language (preferably Java/Scala).</li><li>Experience with Databases (SQL or no-SQL)</li><li>B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience).</li><li>Strong analytical skills.</li><li>Experience leveraging test-driven development methodologies.</li><li>Comfort with Agile operating models (practical experience of Scrum/Kanban)</li><li>Team oriented; strong interpersonal and communication skills.</li><li> Energetic, self-directed, and self-motivated</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Disclaimer</strong><p><br></p>If you feel that this is a good match for your skillsets, please submit a current word version of your resume along with a cover letter describing your skills, experience and salary expectations. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). You can read our job applicant privacy policy here .

title: IT DevOps Engineer
description: Cooler Screens is backed and led by some of the most prominent Chicago &amp; Silicon Valley leaders, advisers, and investors and has developed a digital solution to transform a multi-billion dollar industry and positively affect the buying experiences of consumers in the US and beyond. If you’re looking to get on the ground floor of the next digital revolution and Chicago tech success story – this opportunity may be for you.<p><br></p>As a Full Stack Developer with Cooler Screens, you will use your experience to help us reimagine the digital in-store shopper experience. You will be working hands-on with our technical and design teams creating our in-store IoT solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are passionate about development and eager to expand your knowledge within a fast-paced start-up environment.</li><li>You are an innovator who thrives on tough technical challenges and finds ways to apply technology to solve business problems.</li><li>You’ll work directly with proven leaders as an integral part of the development and growth of our company. Our digital- and design-led culture allows you to think creatively, challenge the status quo, and use your abilities to change the face of retail forever. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience in a full-time development role</li><li>Previous experience as a tech lead or team lead, mentoring junior developers.</li><li>Proven experience with front-end technologies such as JavaScript and React</li><li>Proven experience with back-end languages such as Node.js, Java, or C#</li><li>Proven experience with database systems such as Microsoft SQL, NoSQL, or CosmosDB</li><li>B.S. preferred, in Computer Science or related discipline</li><li>Azure platform experience preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Cooler Screens</u></strong><p><br></p>We are transforming retail cooler surfaces into IoT-enabled screens. Our media platform reimagines the brick-and-mortar shopping experience for consumers in the cooler and freezer aisle while delivering new marketing opportunities and smart merchandising for brands and retailers.<p><br></p>We have an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paid time off, and many other perks. Come join our fast-growing team at our headquarters in heart of Chicago.<p><br></p>We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, native origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Front End Software Engineer
description: Looking for an engineer who can help redesign, deploy, and update the ServiceNow platform<p><br></p>Need heavy enhancements, integration, ServiceNow platform<p><br></p>They use out of the box, so there is really no development except for customization and configuration<p><br></p>Scripting, Automation, GRC, IRM, and utilizing the ServiceNow<p><br></p>Has it’s own Cloud<p><br></p><strong><u>These Are The 4 Focus Areas</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>ITSM</li><li>ITOM</li><li>SECOPS</li><li>IRM</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skill And Experience Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>10+ years of working experience in IT </li><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules, ITSM, ITOM</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Request Technology</u></strong><p><br></p>Request Technology, LLC consists of a group of Associate Recruiters, each of whom has an extensive background within the search industry. We fill positions at every level, from entry level to executive. Our specialties have proven to be our strength within the industry; we have successfully filled more than 80 percent of our available positions. With each engagement, we gain a better understanding of an organizations corporate culture and the needs of IT positions within it. Further more, we partner with our clients to match the candidate’s personality with the company culture by learning about the candidate’s background, which companies they have worked for, why they have left organizations and what motivates them to succeed. Thank you for your interest in Request Technology. For additional information, please visit our Web site at www.requesttechnology.com or call me at 630-717-5865. Because we work on a contingency basis, you have no obligation to us until we find you the right candidate. We back this up by offering you a three-month, money-back guarantee. I look forward to working with you and demonstrating for you firsthand why Request Technology is peerless in a highly competitive industry.
description_json: Looking for an engineer who can help redesign, deploy, and update the ServiceNow platform<p><br></p>Need heavy enhancements, integration, ServiceNow platform<p><br></p>They use out of the box, so there is really no development except for customization and configuration<p><br></p>Scripting, Automation, GRC, IRM, and utilizing the ServiceNow<p><br></p>Has it’s own Cloud<p><br></p><strong><u>These Are The 4 Focus Areas</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>ITSM</li><li>ITOM</li><li>SECOPS</li><li>IRM</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skill And Experience Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>10+ years of working experience in IT </li><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules, ITSM, ITOM</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Request Technology</u></strong><p><br></p>Request Technology, LLC consists of a group of Associate Recruiters, each of whom has an extensive background within the search industry. We fill positions at every level, from entry level to executive. Our specialties have proven to be our strength within the industry; we have successfully filled more than 80 percent of our available positions. With each engagement, we gain a better understanding of an organizations corporate culture and the needs of IT positions within it. Further more, we partner with our clients to match the candidate’s personality with the company culture by learning about the candidate’s background, which companies they have worked for, why they have left organizations and what motivates them to succeed. Thank you for your interest in Request Technology. For additional information, please visit our Web site at www.requesttechnology.com or call me at 630-717-5865. Because we work on a contingency basis, you have no obligation to us until we find you the right candidate. We back this up by offering you a three-month, money-back guarantee. I look forward to working with you and demonstrating for you firsthand why Request Technology is peerless in a highly competitive industry.

Good Team Player Strong Communication skills<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Remote ETL ODI developer duties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Formulates and defines system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding to design, develop, modify, or integrate moderately complex information systems. </li><li>Devises or modifies application systems and procedures to optimize functional requirements including capacity, operating time, response time, and form of desired results. </li><li>Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs, subroutines, and scripts.</li><li>May serve one or more project team roles, such as project lead, business systems analyst, or technical lead, for small to medium efforts.</li><li> Competent to work on most phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities.</li><li> Maintains technical skill set for software languages, databases, platforms, operating systems, utilities and networks needed to support work assignments. title: Data Scientist, Applied Machine Learning - RNA
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Northrop Grumman Space Systems designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation-related systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and related propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization, within Payload &amp; Ground Systems Division (PGSD), provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Systems Engineer/ Principal Systems Engineer in either of the following 2 disciplines: (1) Systems Design or (2) Modelling &amp; Simulation.<br><br>This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location.<br><br>As a part of the SEIT team, a Systems Design engineer is exposed to the front end Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Systems Design Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>creating and refining Model Based System Engineering products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability and dxl script development</li><li>capability assessments to predict requirement compliance</li><li>functional algorithm development</li><li>risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li><li>generating and reporting system Technical Performance Measures</li><li>presenting analysis that shapes the system design and obtaining end-customer buy-in</li><li>Interface development and documentation</li><li>Cyber Security/Information Assurance Support, including the RMF implementation</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a Modeling &amp; Simulation Engineer is exposed to the full life-cycle of Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system is modeled with sufficient fidelity. In the early stages of programs, modeling &amp; simulation is leveraged to understand system CONOPs, inform system architecture, and perform trades. In the later stages as the design matures, field test data is used to verify and validate the models and ensure the payload models are representative of actual performance.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Modelling And Simulation Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Software development of physics-based in-house models and algorithms</li><li>Perform analysis and trades of product line architectures using analytical models and mission level simulations</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Authoring technical documentation such as white papers, proposal technical volumes, program milestone briefings (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR,...), systems engineering design documentation</li><li>Presenting technical analysis to multiple stakeholders</li><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate has recent experience in the fields of either EOIR, RF systems, or both. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialties.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas: EOIR/RF systems: sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers, lasers, LiDAR, optics, visible and IR cameras, focal plane arrays.</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul><strong> Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Principal Engineer- BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 5+ years (or MS with 3+ years, or PhD with 0 years) related experience</li><li>Systems Engineer- BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 2+ years (or MS with 0 years) related experience</li><li>Theoretical knowledge of the System Engineering V-Model and hands on experience executing the systems engineering work flow </li><li>Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving skills, and creativity</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Team players with a strong work ethic and initiative to perform in a cross functional team</li><li>Ability to obtain Top Secret/SCI level accesses</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred</li><li>Working knowledge of RF sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers </li><li>Experience with real-time signal processing in both firmware and software</li><li>Advanced knowledge of orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Knowledgeable in orbit planning in LEO, GEO and cislunar regimes</li><li>Knowledgeable in the use of COTS tools such as AGI's Systems Tool Kit (STK) and Orbital Determination Tool Kit (ODTK)</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Knowledgeable in space systems design and mission planning</li><li>Experience in specification development and requirements derivation using DOORS</li><li>Experience deploying innovative modeling methods for Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) using tools like Cameo</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel up to 15%</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>CompTIA Security+ Certification</li><li>Experience as a system administrator, security engineer, Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO), or other role supporting a system Authorization to Operate (ATO)</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $81,000 USD - $121,600 USD<br><br><strong>Salary Range 2: </strong> $99,800 USD - $149,800 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Test Engineer
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>VC backed stealth startup is hiring for a Rust Software Engineer!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $125,000 - $300,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>Stealth startup backed by Polychain, Tribe Capital, and the Solana Foundation is growing! I've also placed 2 people with them and both have had fantastic feedback on the culture and opportunity. Their product is a blockchain ecosystem that will allow others to build out blockchain to their own application. They’re building a high-performance, modular infrastructure to scale blockchains by separating the “slow” part of blockchains from executing programs and data availability (similar to Cosmos or Polkadot just much faster). With their infrastructure, any application can scale and spin out as its own blockchain without increasing its security risk. They have a very competitive compensation package and great benefits.<p><br></p>In this role, you will be expected to have a deep understanding of blockchain technology and how it can be applied in various industries. You should also have experience with distributed systems and networking.<p><br></p>The Solutions Engineer (aka Forward Deployed Engineer) will work closely with customers to design and implement technical solutions. You will help ensure a great user experience and enable clients to maximize the value they get from the platform, from initial onboarding to ongoing support on questions, problems, or requests. You will also build ongoing relationships with internal and external stakeholders alike, incorporating customer feedback and working cross-functionally to ensure our product continues to meet customers’ needs.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Great health benefits package, Remote flexibility, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match</li><li> Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity </li><li> Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity. </li><li> Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company’s product and as well as the industry at large.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Meet with clients to understand their technical needs and requirements</li><li> Assess technology partnership opportunities and assist in developing the initial integration prototype</li><li> Provide expert guidance and support to clients during the implementation process</li><li> Collaborate with our engineering team to identify and troubleshoot any technical issues</li><li> Lead trainings for business users, developers, and partners</li><li> Stay up-to-date on industry trends and new technologies in the crypto industry</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3-10+ years of software engineering experience</li><li> 1+ years experience working with including Rust</li><li> Bachelor’s in EECS, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent experience</li><li> Previous experience working on a cryptocurrency product (ideally infrastructure) or willingness to learn</li><li> Passion for blockchain technologies and Web3</li><li> High emotional intelligence and ability to empathize with users</li><li> Excellent communication and problem-solving skills</li><li> Ability to quickly absorb new concepts and technologies</li><li> Ability to think strategically and understand the business implications of technical recommendations</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development

partners</li><li> Stay up-to-date on industry trends and new technologies in the crypto industry</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3-10+ years of software engineering experience</li><li> 1+ years experience working with including Rust</li><li> Bachelor’s in EECS, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent experience</li><li> Previous experience working on a cryptocurrency product (ideally infrastructure) or willingness to learn</li><li> Passion for blockchain technologies and Web3</li><li> High emotional intelligence and ability to empathize with users</li><li> Excellent communication and problem-solving skills</li><li> Ability to quickly absorb new concepts and technologies</li><li> Ability to think strategically and understand the business implications of technical recommendations</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer
description: Iron Galaxy Studios is a well-established independent game developer who has partnered with the titans of our industry to ship more high-caliber games than any other indie developer. We’re known for our excellent work on Killer Instinct, as well as bringing Skyrim to the Nintendo Switch.<p><br></p>The Software Engineer will bring expert-level technical knowledge and programming skills while working with diverse, cross-functional teams. If you’re interested in an environment to showcase your talents across multiple exciting projects, this job is for you.<p><br></p>This opportunity is for a full-time position, either in Chicago, IL or Orlando, FL.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with other disciplines to establish and meet performance goals on target platforms</li><li>Debug and optimize both engine and game code</li><li>Maintain up to date knowledge on new programming methods and technologies to quickly adapt to new engines and technologies</li><li>Work with cross-functional teams including production team on scheduling as well as design and art teams on performance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years’ experience working at a game studio</li><li>Advanced understanding of C/C++</li><li>Has worked on at least one game on PS4 or Xbox One</li><li>Comfortable working in any engine</li><li>Able to move between projects with little notice and the ability to adapt quickly</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Position Overview</strong><p><br></p>As the NERC Regulatory Compliance Analyst, you will use attention to detail, technical writing, project management, and critical thinking to support Invenergy’s Reliability Compliance program. Successful candidates will be able to work independently and as part of a team. The Compliance Analyst provides support to the entire Invenergy fleet with emphasis on electricity generation regulatory requirements (NERC &amp; IESO) associated with cyber security and real time operations.<p><br></p>This hybrid position is based out of our office in downtown Chicago.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support a growing operating fleet with the demonstration of real time operations (O&amp;P) and cyber security (CIP) compliance.</li><li>Independently serve as the NERC Program’s Evidence Custodian</li><li>Collect, organize, and synthesize technical data</li><li>Write concise statements that reflect the application of synthesized evidence to the applicable regulatory rule to determine compliance</li><li>Work with internal groups to communicate changes or updates that require action from the projects.</li><li>Support the collection and assimilation of KPI data and reporting</li><li>Conduct ad hoc industry research</li><li>Perform other job-related duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Library Services, Business or equivalent industry experience.</li><li>Minimum of one (1) year of directly working with the application of NERC Reliability Standards.</li><li>Demonstrated experience composing technical narratives and responding to Request for Information. </li><li>Demonstrated project management skills</li><li>Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office, SharePoint, and Adobe Acrobat.</li><li>Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.</li><li>Nimble and collaborative work ethic</li><li>Willingness to travel between 5-10%</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of utility scale and/or renewable power systems is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<p><br></p>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

title: ServiceNow Platform Engineer
description: For more than 30 years, ECI Software Solutions has been providing industry-specific, cloud-based business management software and services to small and medium-sized businesses. With divisions focused on manufacturing, wholesale/retail distribution, building and construction, and field service, ECI's solutions integrate into every aspect of a customers' business to help them level the playing field, run day-to-day operations more efficiently, and free them up to focus on what matters most. It’s how business gets done.<p><br></p><strong> Who is ECI? </strong><p><br></p>At ECI, our mission is to enable the entrepreneurial spirit of small and medium-sized business owners. But ECI doesn’t simply deliver amazing software solutions; we also have an award-winning company culture.<p><br></p><ul><li> We offer competitive benefits focused on employee well-being, including paid volunteer time off! </li><li> We have been named by Achievers on its prestigious 50 Most Engaged Companies To Work For list for the last five years. </li><li> We have received international recognition for our high levels of employee engagement through Certification as a Great Place to Work four years in a row. </li><li> Our culture of creativity, innovation, and leadership has garnered over a dozen International Business Awards (Stevie®). </li></ul><p><br></p>Come join a worldwide team with a strong culture of inclusion, professional development, and collaboration.<p><br></p>To apply for this position, please attach a detailed resume that demonstrates your qualifications and skill set pertaining to this position. Applications without a resume will not be considered.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Responsibilities</strong> include, but are not limited to the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Research and analyze assigned projects to determine what is required to complete the customer’s request successfully. </li><li> Provide detailed estimates for projects based on client-provided technical and functional requirements. </li><li> Ensure estimates of time and cost are as accurate as possible and projects are completed to our quality standards, on time, and within budget. </li><li> Design and code custom web applications and/or report changes. </li><li> Thoroughly test and review each completed project for 100% accuracy. </li><li> Record tasks, time, and communication directly related to each custom project. </li><li> Provide exceptional level of customer service for the customer and communicate with the customer directly as needed throughout the process of any project. </li><li> Learn new software and technologies as needed to maintain technical skills. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong technical skills with C#, Javascript, and HTML </li><li> Microsoft SQL Server &amp; MySQL (MariaDB) Knowledge (for database &amp; queries) </li><li> .NET MVC Framework Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Git Source Code Control Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Stimulsoft Reports Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills </li><li> Outstanding time management skills including the ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Detailed and well-organized written communications skills </li><li> Effective interpersonal skills including communication, teaching, active listening, and customer service </li><li> Able to work as a team player and/or individual contributor internally and externally </li><li> Must be based in the United States </li></ul><p><br></p>You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.<p><br></p>In addition to our competitive salary and award winning culture, we offer an excellent benefit package. We even offer our employees a day off to serve their community! Our company core values are our “CODE”: Crave Greatness, Own the Outcome, Deliver Awesome and Embrace Community.<p><br></p>Apply Now<p><br></p>

title: ETL ODI Developer
description: <strong>Job#: 1330430</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>API Developer </strong></u><p><br></p><strong>Job Description: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is on the API Management team within Digital. The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.</li><li>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.</li><li>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.</li><li>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.</li><li>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features</li><li>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits 6. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team</li><li>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment.</li><li>Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.</li><li>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Typical Day</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development. Hybrid work, need to be at located at commutable distance from Chicago. There will be an in person interview.</li><li>Will be working with team members across the world virtually. Will also be interacting with team members in the Chicago office twice a week.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university. 2. 2+ years or more of software development experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills Required</strong>:<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway or similar.</li><li>Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.</li><li>Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity working in a Scrum environment</li><li>Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Hands on experience with metrics and visualization tools like Kibana, Grafana, or equivalent.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Soft Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal skills</li><li>Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints.</li><li>Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.</li><li>Must be reliable and proactive – able to work independently and meet deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law.
