title: Salesforce Developer || Hybrid
description: *Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote*<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm needs a DevOps Support Engineer. This engineer will focus on DevOps support, maintenance, and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS. This individual will need to possess skills with Java, Python, AWS, DevOps, CICD, Kubernetes, Kafka, Jenkins, Github, Ansible, etc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support terraform, ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li></ul>
description_json: *Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote*<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm needs a DevOps Support Engineer. This engineer will focus on DevOps support, maintenance, and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS. This individual will need to possess skills with Java, Python, AWS, DevOps, CICD, Kubernetes, Kafka, Jenkins, Github, Ansible, etc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support terraform, ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li></ul>

title: Space TS/SCI - Engineer Systems / Principal Engineer Systems (Up to $15k in sign-on bonus for eligible candidates!)
description: <p>Aspen Dental Management, Inc. (ADMI) is one of the largest and most trusted retail healthcare business support organizations in the U.S., supporting 15,000 healthcare professionals and team members at more than 1,000 health and wellness offices across 46 states in three distinct categories: Dental care, urgent care, and medical aesthetics. Working in partnership with independent practice owners and clinicians, the team is united by a single purpose: to prove that healthcare can be better and smarter for everyone. ADMI provides a comprehensive suite of centralized business support services that power the impact of four consumer-facing businesses: Aspen Dental, ClearChoice Dental Implant Centers, WellNow Urgent Care and Chapter Aesthetic Studio. Each brand has access to a deep community of experts, tools and resources to grow their practices, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-quality consumer healthcare experiences at scale.</p><p><br></p><p>Things move fast at Aspen Dental, but you never go it alone. The idea behind the business model is simple – a support system with you at the center. We’re a community that thrives on collaboration and has fun while doing it. Whatever your role, there is always the next challenge to conquer. Aspen Dental breaks down barriers, provides opportunities, and makes it easier to fulfill your ever-evolving ambitions. Explore a culture of possibility. Because here is where you’ll find lives changing lives. As a reflection of our current needs and planned growth we are very pleased to offer an opportunity to join our FP&amp;A team as a Senior Financial Analyst. Core responsibilities and expectations for this position include: driving financial transparency, providing insight into business drivers and key metrics, driving strategic financial planning and analysis, budgeting and reporting, and delivering on financial execution. This is an exciting opportunity with high visibility that is ideal for someone that wants to hit the ground running and make an immediate impact.</p><p><br></p><p><em><u>Responsibilities</u></em></p><p>We are excited to present this position as part of one of the largest and most rapidly growing dental service organizations in the country. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager of FP&amp;A, this position will partner closely with business leadership to uncover areas of opportunity and make recommendations that drive the business forward.</p><p><br></p><p><u>Responsibilities</u></p><ul><li>Supporting leadership by gathering and analyzing key financial and operational data</li><li>Reviewing monthly financial and operational results, comparing to budget and prior periods with a focus on highlighting variances and opportunities to improve performance</li><li>Building business cases that justify multi-million-dollar investments</li><li>Creating ad hoc reports and analyses as requested</li><li>General support of the FP&amp;A leadership team as needed. Projects may include ad hoc modelling, forecasting, and ROI/NPV calculations for major initiatives</li><li>Enforcing data integrity, accuracy, and governance in financial and management reporting</li></ul><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><u>Minimum Education and Experience</u></p><ul><li>BS in Accounting, Finance or other degree with equivalent work experience in Financial Analysis</li><li>2-5 years of experience in Finance, Accounting, or related field.</li><li>Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel</li><li>Ability to find and pull appropriate data, along with validating and reviewing data and reports for accuracy and completion. </li><li>Ability to excel in fast paced environment, take direction, and handle multiple priorities</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are required. Must be a team player</li></ul><p><br></p><p><em><u>About Aspen Dental Management, Inc.</u></em></p><p>Aspen Dental-branded practices are supported by ADMI, a dental support organization that provides non-clinical business support to licensed, independent dentists.</p><p> </p><p>If you are an applicant residing in California, please view our privacy policy here:</p><p>https://careers.aspendental.com/us/en/tag-privacy-policy-for-california-employees</p><p></p>

title: Rust Solutions Engineer - Remote
description: <strong>Cúram Software Developer – Chicago</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems. .<p><br></p>We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for Cúram Software Developer as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. As a Cúram Software Developer you will provide technical design and programming activities You will create technical design for Cúram extensions, configurations and interfaces. You will work with other developers and business analysts to create and test quality Cúram customizations.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive experience (5-7 years) with development, testing and implementation in Java-IBM Curam environment including leadership roles.</li><li>Expertise in Cúram rules development is a plus</li><li>Extensive recent experience with DB2 and SQL</li><li>Demonstrated knowledge and experience of J2EE architecture</li><li>Ability to mentor other programmers in quality design and coding techniques and standards </li><li>Demonstrated experience with n-tier web-based applications, Unix, Shell Scripting, Ant script, Javascript, XML/XSD and source code management tools such as Subversion or Git </li><li>Working knowledge of Web Service, EJB, Messaging and other system integration technologies</li><li>Experience in an enterprise environment with large-scale, complex interdependent systems </li><li>Demonstrated ability to synthesize complex information, applying logical reasoning and sound technical and/or business knowledge </li><li>Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Software Design and Development concepts </li><li>Excellent communication skills </li><li>Self-start who is able to keep the team informed of his progress </li><li>Creative problem solver who can determine alternative solutions </li><li>Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or related field </li><li>Analyze code to find causes of errors and revise the applications as needed </li><li>Participate in software design meetings to analyze and determine user needs are met with technical requirements </li><li>Work collaboratively with broader development team to design, test and implement Cúram code to meet project deadlines </li><li>Maintaining existing applications for current clients </li><li>Constantly improving skills set and sharing new knowledge with other on the team </li><li>Design, develop, document, test and debug complex and large-scale applications </li><li>Participate in the full software development life cycle </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.<p><br></p>We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<p><br></p>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Software Engineer
description: Interview: Phone and F2F ( Client can pay Interview travel expenses to right candidate)<p><br></p>Relocation assistance will be considered for the right candidate.<p><br></p>Our client, a fast-growing, innovative technology firm is looking for a Virtual Reality Software Engineer to join their highly collaborative team in Chicago, IL as a full-time employee. The office is easily accessible to the CTA Blue Line, and nearby the Metra Union and Ogilvie stations. As a Virtual Reality Software Engineer, your role involves working as an individual or with a small, task-oriented team of developers and artists. You will design and develop next-generation and ultra-realistic, digital solutions. You will work with a team of creative and passionate developers and artists, utilize cutting-edge game engines, graphics, haptics and dynamics simulation techniques to create stunning simulations and design revolutionary tools. Our client offers the opportunity to work for a visionary company with a fantastic mission!<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages: C++, C#.</li><li>Proficiency with mainstream game engines ( e.g. Unity, Unreal Engine ).</li><li>Experience in VR / AR / MR software development, knowledge of Oculus; HTC Vive; Microsoft Mixed Reality Devices.</li><li>Strong 3D math skills ( matrix / vector math, trigonometry, linear algebra, etc.).</li><li>Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.</li><li>Self-motivated and willing to learn new knowledge and technique.</li><li>Outstanding mindset for collaboration and communication.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communications skills.</li><li>Ability to travel occasionally for conventions and customer demos.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in front-end design / graphical user interface.</li><li>Experience in real-time computer graphics, knowledge of OpenGL, GLSL.</li><li>Knowledge of digital image processing.</li><li>Understanding of GPU architecture; experience in parallel computation, GPGPU.</li><li>Experience of mobile developments.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Senior Analyst, Reliability Compliance
description: Founded in 2012 and recently named one of the nation’s fastest-growing private businesses by Inc. Magazine, RedShelf is a Chicago-based EdTech company helping to make education both more affordable and more effective by replacing yesterday’s pricey print publications with today’s more dynamic yet far less expensive digital content. Partnering with more than 400+ publishers and 640+ campuses nationwide, we offer leading-edge digital course materials and a seamless, end-to-end Content Delivery System for effectively distributing those materials.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Full-Stack Developer is responsible for implementing features and educating others in your area of expertise while continuing to grow your own skills.<p><br></p><strong><u>Duties &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support your team in delivering well-written, well-tested code to complete new features or address issues in the product</li><li>Collaborate with your team and your peers on the design, implementation, testing, and review of new features and fixes</li><li>Review code and contribute feedback to improve the quality, readability, and testability of the code base within your team and area of expertise</li><li>Strive to understand all aspects of RedShelf’s business to create a better product</li><li>Support paying down technical debt and use development approaches that minimize the growth of new technical debt</li><li>Mentor junior engineers</li><li>Drive good engineering practices</li><li>Support the vision and long-term strategy in your domain of expertise</li><li>Spread learning in your area of expertise</li><li>Ensure that customer-facing UX is accessible for all supported devices and user accessibility needs (WCAG 2.0, Section 508, ADA, etc.)</li><li>Use the Agile Scrum process to experiment and improve on software development practices on the team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of software development experience</li><li>1+ years of experience maintaining the front-end and back-end of a complex, product-focused codebase</li><li>Experience publishing and consuming APIs</li><li>Proven track record of building successful full-stack applications, products or platforms</li><li>Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills</li><li>Experience with Python, Javascript or similar languages</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Desirable Skills/Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with browser-based Javascript and front-end frameworks such as Ember, Angular or React is a plus</li><li>Experience with Python and frameworks like Django is a plus</li><li>Experience building ADA-compliant or WCAG 2.0-compliant interfaces</li><li>Knowledge and appreciation of the advances in higher educational software, course materials, and digital publishing is a plus</li><li>Background and/or experience in educational technology and/or publishing</li><li>Comfort and/or experience in a startup environment</li><li>Ideal candidate is self-sufficient and highly motivated, self-directed and possess high energy and a passion for RedShelf</li></ul><p><br></p>Why RedShelf?<p><br></p>RedShelf prides itself on maintaining an informal but fast-moving, hard-working, entrepreneurial culture. Our team members are smart, innovative, and passionate about improving education through digital technology.<p><br></p>We offer the best of both worlds: the energy and opportunity of a rapidly-growing organization, coupled with the stability of an extensive client base, strong financial backing, and proven track record of success. In addition to a forward-thinking environment with ample opportunity for professional and personal growth, our team members enjoy competitive compensation and benefit packages, including company stock options.<p><br></p>RedShelf is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Women, people of color, individuals with a disability, veterans, and others who would enrich the diversity of RedShelf are encouraged to apply.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Custom Software Developer
description: DEP is looking for a object oriented full-stack PHP developer with Agile/Scrum experience who thrives in a high energy, fast-paced enviornment This is a full-time, ON-SITE position.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full-stack PHP development, proficient in all stages of web development, from conception to deployment</li><li>Must be comfortable with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, Javascript</li><li>Good time management and organizational skills</li><li>Qualifications:</li><li>PHP development experience</li><li>Self-starter with a passion for building high-quality web applications</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience With</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Unit Testing</li><li>Design patterns, specifically MVC</li><li>MySQL</li><li>Git - cloning repositories, pull requests, merging branches etc.</li><li>Bonus, Not Required:</li><li>Experience working with eCommerce or public-facing web applications</li><li>Applicable degree (e.g. Software Engineering, Computer Science, etc.) preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: APIGEE Developer
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.Key Roles and Responsibilities: Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles Demonstrates project management and administration ability Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments Demonstrate customer engagement skills Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge Good verbal communication skills Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems Ability to work under pressure Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members Good understanding of project management principles Academic Qualifications and Certifications: Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent Project management certification Required Experience: Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations Good project administration and documentation experience Report writing experience Basic project management #ownyourfuture<br><br><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?<br><br></strong>Standard career level descriptor for job level:<br><ul><li> Have wide-ranging experience</li><li> Uses professional concepts and company objectives to solve complex issues in creative ways</li><li> Networks with others outside own area of expertise</li><li> Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results</li><li> May coordinate others’ activities</li><li> Typically requires significant related experience with a Bachelor’s or equivalent degree</li></ul>

title: Software Developer – Guidewire InsuranceNow
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>The Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for but not limited to the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Launch new features or capabilities aligned to new or existing business processes or user groups</li><li>Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to drive projects and goals</li><li>Gather business requirements and develop new business processes as part of design activities</li><li>Performs data analysis of identified data issues, if needed</li><li>Identifies use cases and develops test scenarios</li><li>Write test scripts and participate in user acceptance testing</li><li>Develop business process and training documentation as needed</li><li>Perform new and existing user training sessions</li><li>Develop business readiness plans for tool or new capability launches, including change management, communication, and support plans</li><li>Develop strategies to drive adoption of tools, improve efficiencies and increase benefits to the data governance and analytics team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Knowledge &amp; Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years of product planning, sales or IT experience</li><li>Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills with the ability to work under short deadlines</li><li>Self-motivated and ability to operate with limited direction in a fast-paced project-driven environment</li><li>Ability to foster collaborative and effective working relationships to build consensus with cross-functional teams such as regional sales operations, channel operations, IT, Software Enterprise, Services, Drop Ship, Legal, Marketing, Finance, Presales, Order Management, Post Sales, Supply Chain and Credit</li><li>Keen attention to detail and complex problem-solving abilities from an operational and technical perspective</li><li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written required</li><li>Experience working with ERP systems, Salesforce CRM &amp; other Business Operations IT applications</li><li>Supply Chain experience</li></ul> Project Management is plus<p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: DevOps Engineer
description: Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?<p><br></p>With the advent of genomic sequencing, we can finally understand our genetic makeup. We now have more data than ever before but providers don't have the infrastructure or expertise to make sense of said data. Here at Tempus, we are building the infrastructure to modernize cancer treatment. By analyzing a patient’s genetic data in the context of molecular therapies, we empower physicians to make real-time data-driven decisions in clinic based on the comprehensive computational analysis of a patient’s unique pathology. We're looking for QA and Automation Engineers who are passionate about changing the status quo and bringing cancer care into the 21st century.<p><br></p>As a dedicated pod QA Automation Engineer, you’ll play a critical role in fulfilling the mission of Tempus by providing secure and private cancer care for our clients and their patients.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Own quality activities for an engineering team.</li><li>Pair with engineers on automated tests and infrastructure.</li><li>Pair with product leads on acceptance criteria, release readiness and issue resolution.</li><li>Plan team testing activities and support scheduled releases and deployments.</li><li>Establish, monitor and optimize infrastructure and application-level stability, performance and reliability measures and metrics</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2-6 years experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment.</li><li>2-6 years experience with unit, integration, API, and performance automation testing tools like Jest, Nightwatch, JMeter.</li><li>2-6 years experience designing, administering, and leading manual quality activities (e.g. smoke tests, regression tests, etc).</li><li>2-6 years experience at a growth-stage startup or established technology company preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior experience with Jenkins, Docker, and Terraform.</li><li>Prior exposure to Service Oriented Architectures (SOA).</li><li>Coding experience with Javascript, Python, or Ruby.</li><li>Prior work experience in the AWS ecosystem.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Senior Accounting Analyst
description: <strong>Looking for a new Low Level Device Driver Development Opportunity? </strong><p><br></p><strong>I have the one for you!</strong><p><br></p>My client is currently looking for a Software Engineer with Low Level Device Driver Development experience. In this position you will be supporting their Targeting, RF, IRCM teams.<p><br></p><strong><u>Day To Day</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working in an Agile environment with two week sprints, participating in daily standup meetings</li><li>Primarily doing Driver Level Development on Linux/ VxWorks using C/C++</li><li>Have plenty of work within either OS depending</li><li>Starting with new hardware and doing the BSP</li><li>Creating a Linux distribution using Yocto</li><li>Work will be mostly unclassified (not requiring a clearance)</li><li>May require it when they get to integration stage</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Kernel</li><li>Linux</li><li>RTOS</li><li>Device Driver</li><li>VxWorks</li><li>C++</li><li>Yocto</li><li>Xilinx</li><li>FPGA</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Employee Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans </li><li>Abenity Discount Program </li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance </li><li>PTO/Paid Holidays</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>8 + Years Experience<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: Virtual Reality Software Engineer
description: Precise Solutions is an Illinois BEP/FBE (female owned business enterprise) certified consulting company founded in 2000. Our mission is to provide companies with specialized resources that can drive their system portfolio projects using program management processes, change management and blended learning solutions. Please visit our website at www.precise-solutions.com<p><br></p><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following</u></strong><p><br></p>At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries primarily located in the Northern Chicago Suburbs. We are much more than a consulting firm. Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and pension.<p><br></p>Developer- Generic<p><br></p>Rate: $60- $70 hr. including benefits<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Technical skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>C# .NET</li><li>Oracle database</li><li>Angular</li><li>Bootstrap</li><li>SQL/PL/SQL skills</li><li>Transact SQL</li><li>GIT software change management</li><li>Windows server administration</li><li>ServiceNow user experience a plus</li><li>Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision.</li><li>Communication skills essential since they will be authoring design, architecture, unit testing, code movements and knowledge article documentation.</li><li>Well Written and spoken</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills. </li><li>Able to author documentation. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>General Role</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Codes software applications to adhere to designs supporting internal business requirements or external customers.</li><li>Standardizes the quality assurance procedure for software.</li><li>Oversees testing and develops fixes. Requires a bachelor's degree in a related area and at least 8 years of experience in the field or in a related area.</li><li>Has knowledge of standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.</li><li>Generally supports unique/rare skills or niche/emerging technologies, such as Informatica Lifecycle Management, and Micro Focus Content Manager (formerly HPE Content Manager/ HP TRIM).</li><li>Skill set includes programming in Microsoft C#.NET, strong SQL skills, reporting skills (e.g. QlikView).</li><li>Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.</li><li>Performs a variety of tasks.</li><li>May lead and direct the work of others.</li><li>A wide degree of creativity and latitude required.</li><li>Typically reports to a project leader or manager.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and pension.<p><br></p>Developer- Generic<p><br></p>Rate: $60- $70 hr. including benefits<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Technical skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>C# .NET</li><li>Oracle database</li><li>Angular</li><li>Bootstrap</li><li>SQL/PL/SQL skills</li><li>Transact SQL</li><li>GIT software change management</li><li>Windows server administration</li><li>ServiceNow user experience a plus</li><li>Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision.</li><li>Communication skills essential since they will be authoring design, architecture, unit testing, code movements and knowledge article documentation.</li><li>Well Written and spoken</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills. </li><li>Able to author documentation. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>General Role</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Codes software applications to adhere to designs supporting internal business requirements or external customers.</li><li>Standardizes the quality assurance procedure for software.</li><li>Oversees testing and develops fixes. Requires a bachelor's degree in a related area and at least 8 years of experience in the field or in a related area.</li><li>Has knowledge of standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.</li><li>Generally supports unique/rare skills or niche/emerging technologies, such as Informatica Lifecycle Management, and Micro Focus Content Manager (formerly HPE Content Manager/ HP TRIM).</li><li>Skill set includes programming in Microsoft C#.NET, strong SQL skills, reporting skills (e.g. QlikView).</li><li>Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.</li><li>Performs a variety of tasks.</li><li>May lead and direct the work of others.</li><li>A wide degree of creativity and latitude required.</li><li>Typically reports to a project leader or manager.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Mendix Developer
description: <p><strong>C++ Serverside Developer</strong></p> <p>Chicago, Hybrid – 4 Days in Office – 1 Day Remote</p> <p> </p> <p><strong>About The Role:</strong></p> <p>The ideal candidate enjoys working with C++ and server side technologies and thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. This individual will be a part of the Core Server development team and will be responsible for developing and sustaining high performance, multi-tiered, scalable applications. The candidate will enhance existing applications and offer suggestions to improve the architecture and better ways of building and maintaining applications. We are seeking a Market Data Developer, with experience in parsing market data from equities, options or futures exchanges.</p> <p><strong>What You'll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Plan, design and develop high quality C++ server side applications with real-time trading market data. </li> <li>Implement solutions using the latest features of C++11, C++14, C++17. </li> <li>Propose and deliver scalability and performance improvements to our existing applications. </li> <li>Work with developers and traders to receive feedback and articulate ideas for improvements.</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>What We're Looking For:</strong></p> <ul> <li>6+ years of experience with C++ on Linux </li> <li>Experience designing, developing, and supporting server side applications for market data processing, trading, risk management, and monitoring applications.</li> <li>Linux, Multithreading </li> <li>Working knowledge of shared memory, sockets programming including TCP and UDP </li> <li>Working knowledge of object oriented programming, SOLID design principles, and design patterns </li> <li>Good to have deep knowledge of latency measurement and latency optimization </li> <li>Good to have experience with SQL, Thread pools, messaging systems </li> <li>Stay abreast of advances in technology </li> <li>Major in an engineering or technical field</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>OOJ – 1310</strong></p>

title: Full Stack Engineer
description: Job Overview:<p><br></p>We are looking for someone that works hard and is experienced to join our staff on 1st shift. Pay is entirely based on experience. In exchange for your hard work, we offer excellent benefits including medical/dental/vision, 401K with company match, paid holidays, vacation, flexible spending, and much more!<p><br></p>As a CNC Mill Programmer, you will write programs and modify existing ones for our Kitamura &amp; Hwacheon Mills in MasterCam (we will train for PowerMill). Our millss have Fanuc controls.<p><br></p>You'll need to be able to set up, operate and program a CNC Mill, know how to use machinist tools for measuring and indicating workpieces, be able to read and interpret blueprints, and have a mathematical aptitude.<p><br></p>Other qualifications include being able to use various hand tools, being able to work on your own without much supervision, being able to finish setup sheets, and possessing computer skills in order to transfer program files to the appropriate workstation.<p><br></p>We are looking for someone that is self-motivated, organized, and can work well with others as well as work well independently.<p><br></p>Overall, this is a great opportunity to join an organization that prides itself on offering great wages, great benefits, and excellent opportunities to grow professionally!<p><br></p>You should be proficient in:<p><br></p><ul><li>Tool/Die/Mold Repair Skills</li><li>Tool/Die/Mold Setup Experience</li><li>Troubleshooting CNC Machines</li><li>Shop Math Skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Machines &amp; technologies you'll use:<p><br></p><ul><li>CNC Mill (3-4 axis VMC) (Fanuc)<br><br></li></ul> ID:yUx7fb Ref #: 31309<p><br></p>

description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Venture-backed blockchain infrastructure startup is hiring for a Remote Senior Rust Engineer!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $150,000 - $500,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Rust Engineer to join our fast-growing LL2 crypto infrastructure startup. As a Senior Rust Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our core systems and infrastructure using the Rust programming language. Join our dynamic and innovative team, and be part of shaping the future of LL2 crypto infrastructure. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and a stimulating work environment where your expertise will be highly valued and your ideas can make a significant impact!<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, build, and maintain our blockchain infrastructure using Rust</li><li> Work closely with our team of developers to ensure the smooth operation of our blockchain platform</li><li> Develop and implement security protocols to protect our blockchain infrastructure</li><li> Monitor and troubleshoot any issues that arise with our blockchain platform</li><li> Collaborate with other teams to integrate our blockchain platform with other systems</li><li> Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in blockchain technology and make recommendations for new features and improvements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Great health benefits package, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match</li><li> Remote work (local to USA)</li><li> Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity </li><li> Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity. </li><li> Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company’s product and as well as the industry at large.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a talented and experienced Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer to join our Engineering team. As a Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our blockchain infrastructure. You will work closely with our team of developers to ensure the smooth operation of our blockchain platform. This is a permanent position in a dynamic and exciting startup environment.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 2 + years of experience at a crypto native startup, preferably blockchain infrastructure</li><li> Strong experience with Rust programming language</li><li> Experience working with crypto native startup</li><li> Deep understanding of blockchain technology and protocols</li><li> Experience with blockchain security protocols and best practices</li><li> Knowledge of distributed systems and networking</li><li> Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li><li> Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li> Strong communication and collaboration skills</li></ul><p><br></p>If you are passionate about blockchain technology and have a proven track record of building and maintaining blockchain infrastructure, we want to hear from you. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and make a significant impact on the future of blockchain technology.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

My client is planning on staying agile and flexible in regards to strategies and best practices. Staying up to date on current trends as well as paving the way to new ones will be essential in this role.The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. title: QA Automation Engineer
description: <strong>Job Title:</strong> Sr. SailPoint Developer (Sr. Identity Management Developer)<p><br></p><strong> Contract Duration:</strong> 3 months contract to hire<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, and support applications for Identity provisioning and governance</li><li> Build Role Based and Attribute Based Access Control strategies (RBAC)</li><li> Automate provisioning, reviewing, and termination of access within SailPoint Identity IQ</li><li> Manage SailPoint source code and builds for compliance reporting</li><li> Install, customize, configure, and support identity provisioning and governance tools</li><li> Develop Java code for user provisioning, reporting, and role management</li><li> Implement new code into UAT and Production for system development lifecycle</li><li> Lead projects and address high-level gaps and issues</li><li> Create and implement new provisioning and role/group management processes</li><li> Develop audit reports for compliance and monitor SLAs</li><li> Consult on projects, perform security assessments, and ensure RBAC compliance</li><li> Drive RBAC process improvements and problem resolution</li><li> Participate in production support and collaborate with vendors</li><li> On-call rotation participation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS or BA degree in computer science with 8 years of IT experience</li><li> Minimum 2 years of data security experience</li><li> 2 years of experience with access control procedures and processes</li><li> 3 years of SailPoint and HQL programming experience</li><li> Strong knowledge of Java and scripting</li><li> Excellent communication and collaboration skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Metasys Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, veteran or disability status.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Software Engineer - Low-Level Device Driver
description: *Position is Bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a DevOps Kubernetes Engineer. Candidate will be joining the DevOps team and supporting the development efforts for a team that strives for goals that refine and automate the processes needed to support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support Terraform, Ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of Kanban and/or Agile methodologies</li><li>Able to succeed in fast-paced environment with frequent changes</li><li>Comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical audiences</li><li>Self-starter - takes the initiative to research, learn and deliver</li><li>Team player - humble, collaborative, and focused on making sure the entire team succeeds</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li></ul>

title: C++ Serverside Developer
description: Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?<p><br></p>Relativity (Chicago, IL) seeks a Senior Software Engineer to work with Relativity’s Cloud Engineering department and improve an enterprise-sized compute platform by maturing a fleet of over 20 Kubernetes clusters and improving the capability of the job orchestration platform to break additional scale thresholds. Specific duties include: working with Advanced, Senior, Lead, and Staff members of the engineering team to help develop products, features, and services that guide and evolve our SaaS offering; implementing tools and technologies to provision and configuring an enterprise software system in public and sovereign clouds with a focus on increasing efficiency and elasticity of deployed compute without sacrificing quality; contributing throughout all phases of a service lifecycle from conception through development, deployment, and operation; contributing to and maturing existing, automated CICD workflows; overseeing the application environment to run and maintain the technology and determining the advisement of potential technology or process improvements; strategizing, planning, prioritizing, scheduling, and partnering in the development of infrastructure provisioning and configuration while focusing on maintaining or improving security, data integrity, programming logic integrity, and administration; managing the deployment of our infrastructure product and our deployment/upgrade processes; seeking and recommending improvements to current processes and technologies used; and participating in code reviews for projects written by your team. Option to work remotely.<p><br></p>Position requires a Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Computer Science and Engineering, or a closely related field of study, plus 7 years of experience in the job offered, or similar experience in software development including systems engineering, operations, customer engagement, or product management.<p><br></p>Specific experience must include: working in professional software development with commercial-grade systems and applications; working in development while leveraging object-oriented programming or web development tooling such as Java, REST API, Scala, or C#; working with Agile software development methodologies (SCRUM); building and supporting cloud-based software products; and working as a team member, leader, and role model in a collaborative environment.<p><br></p>Option to work remotely. Full time position. Apply by submitting your resumes to Recruiting@relativity.com , to be considered, reference Job ID: 23 - 9004 in the subject line.<p><br></p>Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefit Highlights</u></strong><p><br></p>Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans<p><br></p>Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers<p><br></p>Flexible work arrangements<p><br></p>Two, week-long company breaks per year<p><br></p>Unlimited time off<p><br></p>Long-term incentive program<p><br></p>Training investment program<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: CNC Mill Programmer
description: <strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Experienced Java Developer / Analyst – Chicago</strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for a Java Developer/Analyst as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. As a Developer / Analysts you will provide system analysis, development and production support as part of a project team. The Developer / Analyst will design functional and technical approaches to create and customize functionality. The Developer / Analyst is also responsible for the execution of testing, training, support of user testing and customer support post implementation.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3-5 years' Application and Web Service development experience. </li><li>Understanding of design and development concepts and familiarity with design patterns and the SDLC.</li><li>Ability to effectively communicate with clients.</li><li>Ability to facilitate requirement sessions with the user community.</li><li>Translate requirements into functional specifications for client approval.</li><li>Prepare technical specifications from which programs will be written.</li><li>Analyze and revises existing system logic and documentation as necessary.</li><li>Provide production and implementation support.</li><li>Provide ongoing support, monitoring and maintenance of deployed applications and integrations, working closely with internal teams and vendors as needed.</li><li>Analyze code to find causes of errors and revise the applications as needed.</li><li>Perform review of code from team members and ability to mentor team members</li><li>Hands-on experience with SQL server, DB2 knowledge a plus</li><li>Actively develop software</li><li>Work both independently and as a strong team player to deliver quality technology solutions.</li><li>Excellent written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.</li><li>Demonstrate a clear pride of ownership.</li><li>Propose new ideas, relentless focus on quality and continuous improvement.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.<p><br></p>We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<p><br></p>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Frontend Developer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Sapience, Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>Description:<p><br></p>PURPOSE OF THE JOB<p><br></p>The SPO Platform admin/developer will play a primary role in the SPO Site Creations &amp; onboarding of users in Azure AD. This position requires a breadth of good SPO administrative technical knowledge &amp; experience as well as excellent customer service, task ownership, multi-tasking and team communications skills.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build &amp; Administers SPO Teamsites, environment in accordance with Microsoft best practices.</li><li>Assists with organizing and managing content in accordance with Knowledge Management best practices.</li><li>Gathers requirements, designs, builds, tests, debugs, configures, and documents solutions.</li><li>Automates business processes using SPO/.Net out-of-the-box capabilities.</li><li>Provides SharePoint out-of-the-box solutions and custom solutions when required.</li><li>Provides assistance, training, and routine consultation to users to facilitate the adoption of SPO Solutions.</li><li>Build reports, gauges, and home pages.</li><li>Onboard users in Active Directory to provide SPO permissions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills And Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience developing solutions using out-of-the-box capabilities of SPO</li><li>Proficient in the use of SharePoint Online &amp; nice to have PowerAutomate experience.</li><li>Understands best practices for architecting relational data models using SharePoint Lists.</li><li>Mature communication skills both verbal and written.</li><li>Coordinate and resolve technical data and transformation challenges that are challenging.</li><li>Create, manage, and run reports to meet system performance targets.</li><li>Keep track of the system’s design and operation by documenting it.</li></ul> SharePoint Online Platform Administrator &amp; Developer

title: Layer 2 Rust Developer - Remote
description: Are you passionate about developing cutting-edge AI solutions? Do you have extensive experience in designing, coding, testing, and deploying scalable and reliable software systems? You might be the perfect fit for our Machine Learning Engineer job opportunity!<p><br></p>TackleAI is a Chicagoland start-up software company established to create logical solutions to business challenges. Our diverse team of developers and data scientists combine powerful machine learning with computer vision and proprietary neural networks to turn unstructured documents into intelligible and immediately accessible data.<p><br></p>We are looking for a Mid to Senior Level Machine Learning Software Engineer to join our AI startup. You will be part of a dynamic and talented team that is passionate about creating innovative solutions for our customers. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects that have a positive impact. As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design and implement machine learning pipelines and frameworks using Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch or other tools</li><li>Research and apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems</li><li>Evaluate and optimize the performance and scalability of machine learning models and systems</li><li>Build end-to-end machine learning pipelines, including data ingestion, preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.</li><li>Conduct experiments and perform statistical analysis to evaluate model performance and identify areas for improvement</li><li>Document and communicate your work and results to stakeholders and peers</li><li>Test, debug, and monitor the performance and reliability of the AI systems and applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To be successful in this role, you should have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field</li><li>At least 3 years of professional experience in machine learning, data science, or software engineering</li><li>Proficiency in title: Software Engineer C#/.NET
description: KASTO Germany opened a branch in the Pittsburgh area in 1979. The fluctuating economic development in the USA resulted in this site experiencing both highs and lows – and the "Steel Belt", the region around the city with its then booming steel industry became a "Rust Belt" in times of crisis. Since the end of the 2000s, however, Pittsburgh has been on the rise again, with numerous technology companies settling in and around the city.<p><br></p>The American KASTO Inc. with around 40 employees and an extensive spare parts warehouse is also the contact for KASTO users in Canada. In 2018, the company inaugurated a new showroom with a Technology Centre in Chicago. Among other things, customers can see machines and digital solutions in advance there and carry out test cuts.<p><br></p><strong>Tasks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Commissioning support in-house and partly also at the customer's site </li><li>Project planning for customer projects </li><li>Trouble shooting / second level support </li><li>Conducting workshops with customers to determine requirements </li><li>Developing software modules or modifying software modules for customer individual requirements<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Educational background: Bachelor or Master of computer science, electrical engineering or automation engineering </li><li>At least 5 years of experience in programming in programming language S7 / TIA </li><li>Practical experience in the application of software design patterns </li><li>Practical experience in the development and implementation of object-oriented architecture, especially with regard to the connection of processing machines. Conceptual thinking and systematic approach to problem solving<br></li></ul>

title: DevOps Kubernetes Engineer
description: Job Summary:<p><br></p>Generally responsible for the development, design and implementation of new or modified software products or ongoing business projects. Design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems and/or applications for market sale or large-scale proprietary software for internal use. Serve as technical expert on development projects. Participate in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design. Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements. Support, maintain, and document software functionality. Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation. Analyze code to find causes of errors and revise programs as needed. Participate in software design meetings and analyze user needs to determine technical requirements. Consult with end user to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs.<p><br></p>Primary Responsibilities:<p><br></p>Working closely with other developers, designers, business and systems analysts<p><br></p>Develop web applications and sites that engage and retain visitors.<p><br></p>Provide guidance on industry best practices, guidelines and governance for web applications and web sites.<p><br></p>Work closely with Quality Assurance to ensure end product is delivered with quality outcomes.<p><br></p>Perform benefit analysis for IT solutions and make recommendations for technology direction.<p><br></p>Researching, designing, implementing and managing software programs<p><br></p>Testing and evaluating new programs<p><br></p>Identifying areas for modification in existing programs and subsequently developing these modifications<p><br></p>Writing and implementing efficient code<p><br></p>Determining operational practicality<p><br></p>Developing quality assurance procedures<p><br></p>Deploying software tools, processes and metrics<p><br></p>Maintaining and upgrading existing systems<p><br></p>Key Technical Skills:<p><br></p><ul><li> Programming Language: C/C++, Shell Scripting, AWK, Python</li><li> Databases: MySQL, Oracle, RDS, Redshift</li><li> Version Control : GIT, ADO</li><li> Experience on Cloud based applications (preferably AWS)</li><li> Tools: GDB/DDD debugger</li><li> Environments: Linux, WINDOWS</li></ul>

description: One of the largest health insurers in the nation is focused on continuously building an industry-defining, world-class IT capability. Healthcare is forever evolving, especially due to emerging technologies, making this a great experience to add to your resume. Come join their winning team!<p><br></p>This <strong>Contract </strong> role as a <strong>Hadoop Developer </strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> will be responsible for providing basic design documents and translates into component-level designs to accelerate development. Designs, develops, and distributes reusable technical components. This is a <strong>Hybrid </strong> role.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Participate in sprint planning, design, coding, unit testing, sprint reviews </li><li> Provide basic design documents and translates into component-level designs to accelerate development. Designs, develops, and distributes reusable technical components. </li><li> Assist in developing technical documentation; participate in test-plan development, integration and deployment </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 4-6 years of experience in Big Data development using Hadoop with a good understanding in all phases of software development life cycle. </li><li> Experience using Hadoop Technologies like Hive, Spark, Pig, or Kafka </li><li> Experience using Talend </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits: </strong><p><br></p>Solving IT is pleased to offer a rich benefit plan to our W2 employees. We offer five health plan options and a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&amp;D Insurance, and 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT subsidizes the health and dental premium for the employee.<p><br></p>As you continue to develop your skills and experience, Solving IT will work with your changing preferences to match you with rewarding projects. Our unrivaled reputation for quality is demonstrated through our Inavero Best of Staffing award that was won due to the feedback from our own clients and candidates. We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Hadoop Developer 29392

description: <strong>Looking for a new LabVIEW Opportunity? </strong><p><br></p><strong>I have the one for you!</strong><p><br></p>My client is currently hiring for a LabVIEW Software Engineer to create or modify LabVIEW and TestStand programs to meet testing needs for current and upcoming programs. You will be creating test operational documents to support current and modified programs. This position included Full Lifecycle Application Development, designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis.</li><li> Software experience level: Advanced</li><li> Software modeling and simulation.</li><li> Front-end graphical user interface design.</li><li> Software testing and quality assurance. Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation.</li><li> Support, maintain and document software functionality. Integrate software with existing systems.</li><li> Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation.</li><li> Project Planning and Project Management. Maintain standards compliance.</li><li> Implement localization or globalization of software.</li><li> Ability to write proposal for new projects or modernization of existing equipment</li><li> Design, implement, maintain, and improve electrical test equipment and components.</li><li> Operate computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform engineering tasks.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>C++<p><br></p>C++ Programming<p><br></p>LabVIEW<p><br></p>TestStand<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certified LabVIEW Developer (CLD) preferred</li><li> 1+ years of active TestStand experience</li><li> Experience with CAN, EtherCat, Modbus, TCP/IP</li><li> Experience with CVI, FPGA, and Real-Time modules</li><li> Skill in Auto CAD</li><li> Skill with MS SQL Programming</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Employee Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans </li><li>Abenity Discount Program </li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>1+ years experience<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.<p><br></p>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: SharePoint Online Platform Administrator & Developer
description: <strong><strong>Patterson isn't just a place to work, it's a partner that cares about your success.</strong></strong><p><br></p>One of the distinguishing marks of our company is the talented people who embrace the people-first, always advancing, and results-driven culture. Professional growth abounds in this motivating environment. We value the diverse talents and experiences our employees bring to Patterson and believe that they build a stronger and successful organization.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>We’re looking for a Software Engineer III to join our team!<p><br></p>Here at Turnkey we are the leading provider of software solutions in our industry. We are a team of smart and forward-thinking developers who design and build flexible and resilient solutions to complex problems. This is an advancing software and we’re looking for you to come help us build it.<p><br></p><strong><u>In This Role You Will</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with clients, developers and other team members in the conceptualization and development of new or existing software enhancements. </li><li>Helps research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements.</li><li>Define, develop, test, and maintain our software applications.</li><li>Work in an Agile environment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Sciences, Mathematics, Engineering, Business or a combination of equivalent education and experience</li><li>5 years of programming experience required. Should have experience with:</li><ul><li>ASP.Net Core UI (C#/HTML/Javascript/Razor/Blazor)</li><li>ASP.Net Core services (REST/gRPC) </li><li>SQL Server and/or EF Core </li></ul><li>Experience in Azure deployment and hosting </li><li>Experience with unit, integration, and acceptance testing. </li><li>Experience with enterprise architecture patterns such as multi-master distributed eventual consistency </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with WinForms or UWP</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Xamarin, MAUI, WinUI, WPF, Angular, React.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What's In It For You</u></strong><p><br></p>We provide competitive benefits, unique incentive programs and rewards for our eligible employees:<p><br></p><ul><li>Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits and an integrated Wellness Program.</li><li>401(k) Match Retirement Savings Plan.</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).</li><li>Paid Time Off (PTO).</li><li>Holiday Pay &amp; Floating Holidays.</li><li>Volunteer Time Off (VTO).</li><li>Educational Assistance Program (Tuition Reimbursement).</li><li>Full Paid Parental and Adoption Leave.</li><li>LifeWorks (Employee Assistance Program).</li><li>Patterson Perks Program.</li></ul><p><br></p>The potential compensation range for this role is below. The final offer amount could exceed this range, based on various factors such as candidate location (geographical labor market), experience, and skills.<p><br></p>$71,600.00 - $90,300.00<p><br></p>EEO Statement<p><br></p>As a people-first company, Patterson promotes a culture that embodies and celebrates diversity and inclusivity. We believe our employees’ unique experiences and differences is what strengthens us and drives our success. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.<p><br></p>We are Patterson. We welcome you.

title: Software Developer (C/C++)
description: Hi s,<p><br></p>I hope you are doing well!<p><br></p>We have an opportunity <strong>C/C++ </strong><strong>Software Developer</strong> with one of our clients for <strong>Chicago, IL (Day-1 Onsite/Hybrid).</strong><p><br></p>Please see the job details below and let me know if you would be interested in this role.<p><br></p>If interested, please send me a copy of your resume, contact details, availability, and a good time to connect with you.<p><br></p><strong>C/C++ Software Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (Day-1 Onsite/Hybrid)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Type: Contract </strong><p><br></p><strong>Exp.:</strong> 9-10+ Yrs.<p><br></p><strong>Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Generally responsible for the development, design and implementation of new or modified software products or ongoing business projects. Design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems and/or applications for market sale or large-scale proprietary software for internal use. Serve as technical expert on development projects. Participate in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design. Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements. Support, maintain, and document software functionality. Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation. Analyze code to find causes of errors and revise programs as needed. Participate in software design meetings and analyze user needs to determine technical requirements. Consult with end user to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Working closely with other developers, designers, business and systems analysts<p><br></p>Develop web applications and sites that engage and retain visitors.<p><br></p>Provide guidance on industry best practices, guidelines and governance for web applications and web sites.<p><br></p>Work closely with Quality Assurance to ensure end product is delivered with quality outcomes.<p><br></p>Perform benefit analysis for IT solutions and make recommendations for technology direction.<p><br></p>Researching, designing, implementing and managing software programs<p><br></p>Testing and evaluating new programs<p><br></p>Identifying areas for modification in existing programs and subsequently developing these modifications<p><br></p>Writing and implementing efficient code<p><br></p>Determining operational practicality<p><br></p>Developing quality assurance procedures<p><br></p>Deploying software tools, processes and metrics<p><br></p>Maintaining and upgrading existing systems<p><br></p><strong>Key Technical Skills:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Programming Language:</strong> C/C++, Shell Scripting, AWK, Python<p><br></p><strong>Databases:</strong> MySQL, Oracle, RDS, Redshift<p><br></p><strong>Version Control</strong> : GIT, ADO<p><br></p><strong>Experience On Cloud Based Applications (preferably AWS)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Tools:</strong> GDB/DDD debugger<p><br></p><strong>Environments:</strong> Linux, WINDOWS<p><br></p><strong>AWS certification a plus</strong><p><br></p><strong>Thanks &amp; Regards</strong><p><br></p><strong>Shankar Kr Singh </strong><p><br></p><strong>Extend Information Systems</strong><p><br></p><strong>Cell:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Email: </strong><p><br></p><strong>Address:</strong> 44258 Mercure Circle, UNIT 102 A, Sterling VA, USA 20166<p><br></p><strong>Web:</strong>
